column1: Two slips. Loose ball, short onto his body on middle stump, tucks the ball towards short leg and takes off for the single
back of a length just outside off, lets the ball go through to the keeper. Good carry
pitched full outside off, firmly driven through cover for four. In the slot, and Powell was quick to get bat to ball. Minimal movement of the feet, but good contact
full just outside off, left alone
back of a length just outside off, straightens slightly. And while Powell shouldered his arms comfortably, the ball came in just a little. Goes just past his off stump
full outside off, tries to drive but the away swing takes the ball past his bat's outside edge. That's the first over
full on middle and leg, clipped off his hips towards mid wicket. Early call for the single. Late swing on offer, and the batsman did well to get behind the line of the ball
back of a length just outside off, goes through to the keeper. Brathwaite not interested to offer a shot
good length on that nagging fourth-stump line, left alone

very full on off stump, Powell comes forward to try and defend at it, but it's a really quick delivery. Zips past his outside edge, but before that it clips the outside of his front pad. Loud appeal! Turned down. Zimbabwe are reviewing. Pitched in line, impact in line, but the ball was missing the off stump oh-so-slightly. Comfirmation: Not out.
full outside off, shoulders his arms
full on off stump, defended back past the bowler off the front foot
full on off stump, gets behind the line of the ball and defends with soft hands. Almost like pushing the ball into the ground, but while dropping his gloves at the same time
full on middle and leg, goes down the leg side. Brathwaite tried to whip that off his hips, but couldn't get bat to ball
back of a length outside off stump, goes straight through to Regis Chakabva, the keeper
full on middle stump, Brathwaite falls over the ball, but does enough to defend it off the front foot. Moved towards the off side early. Almost hurt him there
full just outside off, defended towards mid on off the front foot
full just outside off, defended off the front foot. The ball dribbles away towards the fielder at midwicket
pitched full just outside off, lets the ball go, late swing into the left hander, though
back of a length just outside off, shoulders his arms once again. Very good carry through to the keeper. It's a hard deck, this
full outside off, left alone
full on middle and off, crunching drive back to Mpofu, he dives to his left, and stops what may have been atleast two.
full outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, gets inside the line of the ball and pushes it towards mid on
back of a length outside off stump, swings slightly away from the batsman's body. Shoulders his arms.
good length just outside off, much closer to the outside of off stump. The batsman lets that go through to the keeper
pitched short outside off, the ball's angling away from the right hander, and he simply lets it go past him
pushed fuller just outside off, gets onto the front foot and punches the ball back to the bowler
back of a length just outside off, slower delivery to end the over. Tucked off his hips to midwicket. But there's a fielder positioned there
full ish just outside off, Powell decides to leave that
full just outside off, Powell sees it through. No shot offered, the keeper collects from chest high
good length but drifting to leg stump, tucked to fine leg for a single. First run after 25 dot balls
back of a length on middle, gets himself slightly into a tangle, but fends it off his chest. Went deep into the crease for that shot
back of a length outside off, lets it go
good length on middle, shuffles towards the off side and works the ball off his feet towards backward square
Beautiful! Back of a length on middle and off, and goes juuuust past the top of off stump. He shouldered his arms, but calculated the direction of the ball well. Well left
good length on off stump, prods forward thinking of playing a shot, but shoulders his arms eventually
full on leg stump, tries to flick that off his pads over midwicket, but misses the shot. It was a loose delivery, but couldn't make the necessary contact. Jarvis escapes with the bad ball
back of a length just outside off, left
full on off stump, a perfect straight drive. Gentle push through the line of the delivery and that races past the non-striker's right for a boundary
full outside off, lets that go through to the keeper
full on middle, tapped towards midwicket off the front foot
back of a length just outside off, bunted towards mid off
full on middle, played past midwicket's left and calls quickly for the single
full outside off, tries to play the straight drive once again, but the bat turns in his hand. Was through the shot too early.
back of a length just outside off, shoulders his arms
bowls from a slightly wider angle, comes into the left hander after pitching back of a length. Lets the ball go through to Chakabva
full just outside off, pinged off the front foot straight to short cover
first real short ball of the day, pitched on middle and sends Brathwaite scampering. Got into a tangle once again, as he tries to play it down the leg side. No contact

full outside off, and this one straightens after pitching. A peach! Brathwaite prods at the shot, trying to defend the ball off the back foot, and it takes the outside edge. Straight to Chakabva's gloves, who makes no mistakes. Jarvis strikes
Starts off with the short ball. pitched on middle stump and goes past the batsman's leg side. Didn't trouble anyone
full just outside off, left alone. Straightens slightly after pitching.
full on off stump, driven down the ground to get off the mark. Goes past the bowler and mid on puts in the dive to his left as well, but in vain. Four to end the over.
short outside off, forces Powell to tiptoe. Defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, enough width to cut or slash at it but Powell resists the temptation. Lets it go through
full just outside off, defended with soft hands. No real foot movement though
full and wide outside off, very wide in fact. Just inside the rail-tracks. Left alone
delivered from wide around the wicket, good length just outside off, gets onto the back foot and defends it firmly with soft hands
full and wide outside off, Powell is disinterested
good length just outside off, gets inside the ball's line and defends. Quick shuffle of the feet from Hope to negate that delivery
back of a length outside off, the ball swings into his body, and despite him shouldering his arms, the ball doesn't take the top of off stump. Goes just over the stumps, and through to Chakabva.
back of a length just outside off, worked off his hips from the depth of the crease towards the short mid-wicket region
back of a length on middle and off, worked towards the leg side with ease but straight to the fielder positioned at midwicket
full on middle and leg, allows the batsman to tap that towards the leg side. Goes past midwicket, who gives it a chase. Square leg cleans that up. Got into position early for that shot
back of a length on middle stump, the batsman walks to the off side and turns the ball off his hips to fine leg for a single
back of a length just outside off, the batsman sees the first ball through as he defends it towards mid on. The bat turned slightly while playing the shot, went squarer than he wanted to
short just outside off, worked off his hips towards backward square. Wanted the single, but the non-striker was not interested

full on off stump, spongy bounce and the batsman was through with his on-drive too early. It was in the air, and mid on almost did enough to take the catch, but falls just short of him. Meanwhile, there was a confusion between the two batsmen as well. Powell was late to hear the call for the single
short on leg stump, swivels and pulls along the ground, but straight to fine leg
back of a length just outside off, worked towards midwicket off the front foot

slower ball on middle stump, Hope pounces onto that in a flash. Raises his front foot to make room for the bat's full swing, and pulled over the square-leg umpire's head for four. Fine leg, who was pretty square in the first place, had no chance
back of a length on off stump, defended off the front foot. Firm shot
full and wide outside off, shoulders his arms. Not much happening for Mpofu from around the wicket
back of a length just outside off, left alone
back of a length once again outside the off stump, Powell pokes at that off the front foot, takes the outside edge and goes towards point
good length outside off stump, Powell lets that go once again.
full and wide once again, Powell is not chasing anything that is that wide. Lets it go. Time for drinks.

oh no. Fine start after the break. A full delivery outside off, on a fourth-stump channel. Kyle Hope plays the line, but the ball holds its line, takes the outside edge and goes through the keeper and a wide slip. Quite straight to a regulation slip.
fullish delivery around off, defended back
nice lines. Outside off, the ball seaming back in, worked away into the midwicket region
shortish delivery outside off, the ball comes back in, Hope stands tall and defends into the off side
130 kph, overpitched on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
full delivery outside off, Hope gets forward and defends into the off side, towards short cover
the lines have been very good this morning. 132 kph, full on a fourth-stump line, defended to mid-on.
130 kph, full delivery outside off, driven towards short cover
good length on a fourth-stump line. Not much Powell can do but defend
slight width, and Powell has had enough of plodding about. He gets underneath the length and lofts the ball over extra cover for four. No one there, very safe shot
fullish around off, defended back, 122 kph, may have been the offcutter, pace off the ball
full and very wide outside off, left alone nicely enough
132 kph, a yorker outside off, jammed out towards gully
short and wide, too much width, slashed to backward point

drags that length back just enough to allow the ball to hold its line enough. Hope plays the line, and misses the ball. But Cremer is coaxed into reviewing. Was there a nick? Mighty close to the bat. There is a spike as the ball passes the bat on UltraEdge, and that should be plenty evidence to overturn this decision. Mire's maiden Test wicket. And what a ball to do so, pulled that length back, and what it did was leave Hope tentative - whether to come forward or go back. Eventually, he poked at the ball from the crease, which has trouble all over it. Well bowled.
a nervy start. Overpitched outside off, the ball moving back in, skewed off the inside half towards midwicket
good length around off, Hope stands back and defends back
126 kph, that's too full. Overpitched outside off, driven away towards short cover, where Ervine dives to his left
full delivery outside off, 128 kph, defended to mid-off
good length on middle and leg, pushed away towards mid-on. Solid is Powell
on a length around off, 131 kph, pushed back to the bowler
nice and full around off, defended back. Very disciplined from Zimbabwe, very impressive
good length around off, defended into the mid-off region
short and wide outside off, Powell stays back and carves a cut to point
full delivery outside off, 130 kph, defended into the off side
full and far too wide outside off to draw a stroke. Hope happy to let it go
fine shot. Slightly short outside off from Mire, and Hope reads the length early, goes back and punches the ball through cover for a couple. Slow outfield, the rain has something to do with it
full around off, defended into the off side
full and wide outside off, another leave, bounces in front of the keeper, 129 kph
full on a fourth-stump channel, 129 kph, defended back. Terrific bowling
good length outside off, 129 kph, Powell stands tall and pushes the ball to mid-off
good length down leg, worked down to fine leg for one. Strays in line, a terrific ball to a right-hander though
well-adjusted. On a length, fourth-stump line, guided towards point
126 kph, full and straight, Hope brings his bat down at an awkward angle, and the ball skews to cover
short, Hope picks the length early, goes back and pulls through square leg for four. Well played, it's a loose delivery considering the pace of the surface and the line, and he didn't let it go
127 kph, full outside off, driven nicely to mid-off
129 kph, overpitched outside off, driven to cover
132 kph, fullish around off, driven to mid-on. Slightly too full
nice and full again. Pitches in line but Powell's bat comes down straight and sends the ball to mid-on
fuller than a good length - quite the ideal length on this pitch, outside off, left alone
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full and straight, 130 kph, Powell gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg. That one almost sneaked through
126 kph, slightly leg side-ish, worked away into the leg side, in front of mid-on for a quick single
quick around off, great length, defended back ably enough
full and wide outside off, swings away, left alone
full delivery outside off, 128 kph, left alone from Hope
good length delivery around off, defended nicely. Head over the ball, eyes on it
on a length on off, defended back.
generous turn to begin. Pitches on leg, spins prodigiously down leg. Good take from the keeper
full outside off, very loopy. Powell badly misread the length of that, full outside off, worked to mid-on for one from the back foot. Should have been forward to that
overpitched on middle, Hope gets forward, opens the face of the bat and guides the ball to extra cover
too full outside off again, driven to mid-off
quick down leg, spinning down, nudged down to fine leg for one
a thick outside edge down to third man for one. Flight outside off, Hope gets forward, a thick outside edge trickles down to the fielder.
quick outside off, too wide. That's a freebie, one of very few this morning. Hope eases forward and gently drills his drive through cover
short down leg, should have been put away, but Raza misses a flick
nice and full around off and middle, defended into the leg side
short on leg, an easy flick earns Hope one. Not much spin for Raza, maybe because there are not many revs on the ball
quick outside off, Powell goes back and drives towards cover
short and wide, should have been put away but Powell's cut finds point. Another poor ball
80 kph, tossed up on off, Hope opens up his stance and bat face but finds cover with his drive
lots of flight on middle, driven to a deep mid-off for an easy run. Don't like that position, he should not be giving one without Hope going over him
the googly on middle and leg, Powell reads it and defends
82 kph, big appeal, no says the umpire. Looked like it struck him well outside the line. Flat and wide outside off, Powell missed a sweep. Umpire's call on impact
pushed into the off side region for a run towards point
lots of flight outside off, inviting the drive, Hope does but finds cover. That's well bowled.
shortish outside off, Powell goes back and drives to the sweeper cover from the back foot
too many easy singles. Quick on leg, punched to long-on
84 kph, tossed up outside off, driven crisply to cover
gets past slip for a run. Quick outside off, Powell goes back, gets a thick outside edge which dies in front of slip, the ball goes through, third man has to clean up
spin! Lots of it. Quick down leg, the ball misses the flick and the keeper's gloves down leg, and goes down for a couple of byes
good technique from Hope. Down leg, nudged down to deep square leg, kept his hands soft on the handle and played the ball down
80 kph, quick outside off, may have been the googly, defended back
oh nicely bowled. Pitched on leg or outside, Hope goes back and plays into the leg side
opens the bat face and drives towards sweeper cover
short on middle and leg, Powell hurries back and works the ball into short leg's body
flight outside off, 80 kph, smothered back
overpitched, lots of flight, driven away to long-on for one to end the session
Back of a length on middle stump, plays down the wrong line trying to play straight, and raps him on the pad. Loud appeal from Jarvis. Turned down by the umpire. There was an inside edge
good length on middle stump, defended back to Jarvis off the back foot
full on off stump, driven square but not timed well. Straight to cover
good length on leg stump, tries to clip it off his hips, but misses the shot. Hits him on the pad, and another loud appeal but not out. Pitched a couple of inches outside leg stump.

full on middle, angling away from the left-hander, and driven on the up. Craig Ervine, at cover, dives to his left to stop what would've been a certain boundary. Mid on intercepts the block, and throws back in. Quick single
back of a length just outside off, tiptoes on the back foot and defends with soft hands
full outside off, looks to drive it, but the bat turns, goes to mid on instead. Early call for the single.
back of a length on leg stump, sharp legspin, defended off the back foot from front of middle stump.
full on middle, defended
overpitched on off stump, sharp legspin and hurries Shai Hope into defending that off the back foot. He had gone deep into the crease to play the shot, but the ball hurried after pitching
full on off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up full on middle and off, keeps the infielders interested as Shai Hope steps back and defends, ensuring his hands stay soft
full on middle, prods forward and defends
back of a length outside off, Powell plays an uncharacteristic slog-pull. Takes the top edge, and flies over second slip's head for a boundary. Jarvis won't mind that
full on middle stump, goes deep and defends off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, steps forward and defends it firmly. Straight to mid off
back of a length on middle, worked behind square for a single
back of a length on middle and off, brings out the back-foot defense
full outside off, pushes it towards the off side but goes straight than he would've wanted to play that. Goes to cover in front of square
back of a length on middle, turn takes the ball down the leg side, and Powell just about gets out of the way. Takes the keeper's glove and goes to leg slip's hand
full on middle, keeps Powell guessing, defended somehow
full on off stump, worked towards the leg side for a single. Played with the turn
tossed up full outside off, goes straight through and Shai Hope shuffles to his right to get behind the ball's line
full on off stump, plays the square drive. Cremer is giving the ball a real rip
good length on off stump, nagging line, forcing Powell to play at it. Defended to short cover

not fast enough, but short on middle, Powell quickly gets into position to pull and it goes one bounce to the deep-square boundary. Almost a four, if it wasn't for Waller, who dived acrobatically to his right to stop the ball from going past him. Saves three runs
back of a length on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length just outside off, defends it with ease. The ball dribbles away to mid on
short outside off, gets up onto his toes and pushes the ball square off the back foot. Dissects cover and point, and allows for more runs
full on off stump, punched back to Jarvis
good length just outside off, turns into the left-hander, whipped from top of off stump to square leg. There's a fielder placed there
back of a length on middle stump this time, Powell goes very deep into his crease, and turns the ball square - past the square leg fielder - for two
good length on middle and off, moderate spin into the left hander's body, defended with soft hands
tossed up, full on middle and leg, played with the turn down the ground, Cremer tries to stop it but fails. But mid off does well to intercept
full on middle and leg, almost a yorker, dug out well
full on middle, gets his front foot in front and taps the ball back to the bowler. Safe cricket
short and slow on middle stump, that spongy bounce once again, defended off the top of his toes
full toss outside off, driven with ease past cover for four more. Powell goes into his forties. The batsman was quick to pounce onto a rare bad delivery
pitched full on middle stump, turns the ball towards the deep midwicket fielder for a single
full on middle and leg, clipped off his legs to mid on. It goes straight to the fielder, but the call for the single was early. They scamper through
full on off stump, driven straight to the fielder positioned at cover
full on off stump, clipped off his toes to mid on.
back of a length on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler
full outside off, entices Powell to drive and he obliges. It's slightly in the air, as the ball goes past the bowler and Shai Hope, for a single. Played it too straight than what he intended
back of a length on middle, turn and bounce on offer, rocks back and tries to pull the ball square but too close to Hope's body for any power to be generated. Goes to mid on's right
full on middle and off, played square to the fielder at cover. Uses the bat's open face
back of a length on middle stump, turns away from the right hander, but this time Hope is ready for that shot. Pulled square, past midwicket, allowing for the double
full on middle and off, driven firmly down the ground to the fielder at mid off
back of a length outside off stump, the around-the-wicket angle brings the ball into the left hander, defended
short and wide outside off, punched off the back foot to the diving point fielder. Sikandar Raza had to dive to his right to stop the single
good length on middle and off, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
short on middle, rocks back and pushes in front of square on the leg side. Calls early for the single
yorker on middle and leg, squeezed out by Shai Hope
full on middle and leg, worked in front of square on the leg side, but straight to short midwicket
clipped off his legs, uppish, to the deep square leg fielder
full on off, legbreak, left alone
lots of flight outside off, drilled to extra cover
drops short does Cremer on middle and leg, Hope rocks back, picks the length early and swats a pull over midwicket
short on the hips, Powell helps himself to a run through square leg. Can't bowl there
goes full, around off, went slightly wide of the creases did Mpofu. Defended watchfully
too full, gentle pace, 126 kph, defended towards cover. Lovely languid drive
an offcutter outside off, Hope shoves his bat behind the front pad to avoid playing. Let himself get beaten
135 kph, a change-up in pace, full around off, jammed away towards mid-on
full and wide outside off, left alone, too wide to draw a stroke
tossed up full on middle, clipped off his toes to the sweeper-fielder on the leg side
driven on the up, goes to cover, who misfields
full on off stump, brings his front foot forward and defends, but it's a bat-pad. Falls just in front of short leg
full on middle and off, defended once again
full on middle, goes back and defends off the back foot. Sharp turn
ooh, what turn for a second-session pitch. Full-ish on middle and leg, turns further down the left hander's leg side. Powell tries to get out of the ball's way
back of a length on middle stump, gets his front foot in the air and pulls behind square. Greenidgesque.
good length just outside off, comes forward and defends

short and wide outside off, Powell pokes at it, and takes the top edge of his bat once again! Goes just past the diving wicketkeeper, and through for four. That's fifty for Powell. He almost thought of letting that ball go, eventually deciding to play the upper cut. Wasn't connected well, and perhaps, it's Mpofu's pace that even foxed the keeper
good length on middle, goes down the leg side
back of a length on middle and off, goes back and taps the ball to midwicket. Calls early for one
back of a length just outside off stump, punched off the back foot to cover
back of a length on off stump, goes the other way this time, gets onto his back foot and punches the ball towards cover-region. The first wrong'un employed by Cremer
back of a length just outside off, tapped to point and says 'no!' to the call for one
flighted outside off stump, it's full, and driven to the sweeper-fielder on the off side.
full on middle, Powell dances down the wicket and tries to slog it over midwicket. Takes the inside of the blade, and flies fine to the fielder at fine leg
full on middle and off, driven down the ground
back of a length on off stump, turns away from the right-hander, who plays it off the back foot towards point. Opened the face of the bat
full just outside off, tapped along the ground off the front foot. Straight to short cover
full on middle stump, spins into the left-hander's body, keeps his eyes on the ball and defends firmly
full on middle and leg, dances down the ground and drives furiously, but straight back to Williams, who does well not to lose a finger or two
full on middle, turn takes the ball down the leg side
back of a length on middle and off, punched to short midwicket
back of a length just outside off, tries to work the rising delivery towards the leg side, but goes one-bounce straight to the fielder at short leg
flighted full on off stump, gets to the pitch of the ball and defends
back of a length on off stump, opens the bat's face and glances the ball to point
full on middle, brings out the extravagant cover drive, but it's too close to his body for the full shot. Straight to cover
full on middle and off, driven square this time, on the up, but straight to the fielder at extra cover
full on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler, no spin on this one
full on leg stump, gets his backfoot out of the way, and driven past mid on's right for runs. First run in 12 balls.
short outside off, sits up for Hope to hit into the off side
82 kph, slightly too full outside off. Hope stretches forward to drive to the sweeper cover
quick outside off, short, Powell hurries back to defend
slow outside off, Powell runs down and drives to long-on for one
quick on middle, wide of the crease, defended
nice and slow this time, on leg, Hope gets right forward to smother the ball
short outside off, the ball spinning back in, Powell goes back and pushes to cover

out comes the paddle sweep, has it carried? Zimbabwe want to review it. Cremer had asked short leg if it carried, he said yes, and they went on with the review? Definitely off the pad, was it off the face of the bat? Yes, there is a spike on UltraEdge and the on-field not-out decision should be overturned. Not a bit spike, but there is enough to suggest that the ball clipped the inside edge onto the pad. Two fantastic reviews from Zimbabwe. Ervine took a sharp, low catch, running to his left. 'He's got a touch on this,' says the third umpire. Powell has made another start, without going on.
fine start from Cremer to Chase. Quick outside off, the ball spinning away, Chase leaves

the googly. Terrific delivery, goes right through Chase, beats him all ends up on the inside edge, the extra revs imparted on the googly makes the ball bounce extra over the leg stump. Yikes, that's stunning execution of the googly
the legbreak outside off, defended into the off side
overpitched flight on leg, smothered back to the bowler
extracts some spin, takes the outside edge of Chase, he'll be happy with one. Quick on middle and leg from wide of the crease. Chase takes his bat far too wide outside leg
slow on leg, loopy, defended
quicker through the air, on middle and leg, kept out
88 kph, pushed through on leg, pushed back to the bowler
slightly shorter outside off, Hope goes back and pushes towards point
nice forward press to the ball to smother the spin. Well bowled again
flight outside off, 82 kph, played away towards point with the spin
slow through the air, around leg, kept out

lovely shot! Overpitched on middle and leg, Chase clears his front leg slightly to allow his bat to come down straight and drive it back past the bowler and the non-striker. Fantastic place to hit the ball
the googly, this time he picks it, hurries back and flicks the ball into the gap at midwicket for two
nice and slow outside off, Chase gets forward and defends
nice and loopy on off. 'Naais coffee,' goes Chakabva. Chase gets right forward to smother the spin
pushed through, quick on leg, defended out
lots of flight on leg, driven to mid-on. Full enough to play against the spin
short down leg, worked away through square leg for one
another fine stroke. Quick on the pads, Chase drives wide of mid-on. Jarvis dives to his right to cut it off
slow around off, Hope gets forward to defend
84 kph, slow through the air outside off, pushed out to extra cover. Another tidy over
84 kph, shortish and wide outside off, dabbed towards backward point
slow through the air, wide outside off, it's so loopy that Chase is lulled into a forward prod, but the spin takes it past the edge
short outside off, Chase goes back and pulls to mid-on
quicker, down the leg side, nudged to midwicket

flight down leg, Chase is intent on not letting Cremer settle, he got underneath the length and lofted the ball waaay over midwicket. Fantastic execution, full enough to allow him to hit against the spin
short on off, the old 1-2. Chase stays back, knows what's coming and flat-bats a pull through midwicket for four
short outside off, some spin, defended into the off side
nicely bowled. Floats this up outside off, draws Hope forward and then generates enough turn to take it past the outside edge
quick around off and middle, kept out
slightly short and quick, Hope picks the trajectory, goes back and works the ball through midwicket for some runs
beautiful shot. Too much flight outside off, and too full. Hope opens his stance and thrashes a square drive through cover point
short outside off, punched out past point. There is a sweeper cover in place to cut that off
short outside off, some spin, left alone
short and wide again, too much width. Hope reaches out and guides his slap down, to extra cover
loads of flight on leg, kept out
nicely tossed up around off, Hope gets forward to smother the spin
excellent length. Slow on off, Hope is indecisive, he eventually decides to go back and defend awkwardly
84 kph, plenty of flight on that, full and wide outside off, carved out to extra cover. Hope wanted one, but decided against it later
overpitched flight outside off, driven to short cover
short outside off, some turn, played into the off side
slow on middle and off, Chase clears his front leg and defends
quick on the pads, no turn, beats the inside edge and hits Chase on the pad
full outside off, defended towards extra cover for one
quick on the pads, pushed through, defended easily enough
short on middle and off, Chase goes back to defend
full outside off, driven into the off side
the googly on leg, worked away into the body of short leg.
a juicy full toss on leg, pushed down to long-on. Carefully putting away the slog
the googly on off, smothered back

was that dropped? Masakadza says he didn't take the catch. Umpire Reiffel began his redundant journey to the square leg umpire, but Masakadza said we'll save some time. Lots of flight outside off, Hope got a thin outside edge, which hit the keeper's gloves before ricocheting towards Masakadza, the ball pops out
quick on middle and leg, defended
quick outside off, pushed into the off side
slow on leg, nice length this, Chase gets forward to defend
short outside off, the ball spins away, 88 kph, guided away to backward point
overpitched, pushed through full on leg, driven to mid-on
quick on leg, the ball skids on, takes the inside edge and ricochets to square leg
short on off, sits up for Hope at 128 kph to get on top of the bounce and pull through square leg for four. Easy runs
full and wide outside off, no stroke offered
a low full toss outside off, carved away towards backward point
short and wide this time, enough width for Hope to go back and cut towards extra cover
full and wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, dabbed down to backward point for one
short and slow on middle, defended watchfully off the back foot
short down leg, off the legs, trickles back towards the keeper
short and wide, slashed to the sweeper cover on the off side
oh beauty. Short outside off, the ball pitches on middle and spins away, Chase goes chasing after it, the hands following the ball, beaten on the outside edge
shortish and wide, pushed into the off side
Hope picks the length of that, short enough and not quick enough for him to go back and pull into the gap at midwicket for three. Another fine stroke.
short and wide outside off, the ball sits up for Chase but he can only chop the ball into the off side
short delivery around off, Chase stands tall and defends
shortish and wide outside off, 131 kph, carved away towards gully
full and straight, driven towards mid-on from the crease
full delivery outside off, Chase gets forward and drives the ball towards cover
short on middle, Hope opens up his body to hit the ball into the off side, towards cover
there is Hope's fifty. Short down leg, an easy flick down to fine leg. Nothing easy about this fifty though, diligent effort
91 kph, quick outside off, driven into the off side
slow on off, Hope gets right forward to defend that
slightly short and wide outside off, punched to the sweeper cover from the back foot

and he has a wicket! Hope asks his partner and then reviews. Given by umpire Reiffel. Flight outside off, the ball spinning back in, the ball beats the inside edge, or just kisses it, en route to the pad. The ball then ricochets towards slip to catch. The bat has hit the pad, but not the ball. He was also struck way outside off, so that should be overturned. The umpire checks HawkEye, but struck him outside the line.
short down leg, worked with the spin to short leg
flat outside off, some spin back in, worked to midwicket with the spin
more flight outside off, drilled in the gap between mid-off and cover for some runs. Mire cuts it off at mid-off
too full outside off, Hope gets down and drives easily through extra cover for three. Some hesitation about the third but Chase's long strides take him in, no trouble at all
short outside off, Chase goes back and works the ball into the leg side. That will be tea
back of a length on middle stump, tucked behind square on the leg stump. And we're on our way once again
short on middle and leg, worked down the leg side to fine leg for a single. Was a slower delivery
short outside off, it's a rising delivery but left alone by Chase
back of a length on middle, awry line, clipped off his hips past the square-leg umpire for more runs
slower ball, back of a length just outside off, Hope lets it go straight through.
full on middle, driven down the ground to the bowler. Does well to stop it on his followthrough
full outside off, emphatically driven to mid off. The footwork, though, was found wanting
back of a length on middle, shuffles towards the off side and taps the ball to midwicket
fullish just outside off, gets his front foot forward and punches the ball down the ground. Long on retrieves
full on middle, Chase makes room and glances the ball down the leg side for a single. Fifty-run partnership for the duo.
full on middle, driven back to Raza
full just outside off, gives the ball a big hoick. Goes along the ground towards cow corner, and long on has to run to his right to stop that
military medium now, full outside off, shoulders his arms.

full on middle, but drifts slightly towards the leg side, allows Chase to clip the ball off his pads, and it's gone past midwicket's right. He calls early for the triple, and they complete it with ease. Good use of the angles
full and wide just outside off, driven down the ground to mid off
full on middle, shuffles towards the off side and punches down the ground to mid on
pitches it short just outside off, Shai Hope considers pulling or hooking, but chooses against it. The keeper collects it from near head high
back of a length just outside off, Mpofu rolled his fingers over that ball reducing it's speed, defended with soft hands off the back foot
tossed up full on middle and leg, easily driven down the ground to long on
back of a length on middle, goes deep into the crease and tucks the ball past short leg
fullish just outside off, mistimed drive to mid off
good length just outside off, walks towards the off side and taps the ball past short leg
good length on middle, shuffles towards the off side again and helps the ball down to fine leg
tossed up, flighted on middle and leg, the batsman shovels it towards the leg side. They walk through for the run
overpitched on middle, hurries Hope, who punches it off the front foot to mid on
good length on middle, goes deep into the crease and punches the ball back to Mpofu
good length just outside off on the fourth-stump line, defended off the front foot with soft hands

short and wide outside off, Hope adjusts to make room and create extra width, spreads both feet wide and then opens the bat's face on the up, and sends it past cover and point for an exquisite four. Class
short just outside off, rising delivery and going above Hope's head
back of a length outside off, Hope tries to repeat that punch from two balls ago. Not timed as well this time, straight to point
back of a length just outside off, tries to work it behind square on the leg side, but takes the leading edge. Falls in front of cover
fullish outside off stump, tapped to cover
full outside off, tries to drive towards the off side, but the bat turns. Goes to short mid on
full outside off once again, misses the cover drive this time too. Short mid on collects
back of a length on off stump, clipped off his hips behind square on the leg side for a single. Smart cricket from the batsman, because he was almost losing his patience
full on middle and off, prods forward and defends off the front foot. Sees the over out
short to begin with, pitches on middle and leg, goes down the leg side
back of a length just outside off, shuffles, gets behind the ball's line, and defends off the back foot
good length just outside off, comes slightly in and Chase defends firmly off the front foot
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, going down the leg side and Chase helps it on it's way to fine leg
full on middle, Chase shuffles and drives it emphatically to mid on. Well timed, but not well directed. Straight to Cremer
full on middle, sharp offspin, as the ball goes past his backfoot defense. Raps him on the pads, and appeals. Not out says the umpire

But Raza will have the final laugh! Good length on off stump, sharp offspin once again and this time it takes the inside edge of his bat. The ball smacks his pad after that, but that only makes the ball loop further, helping the short-leg fielder to pounce onto that in a flash. Chase has to go, and the partnership is broken.
back of a length on middle, spins into his body, tries to whip it fine on the leg side but the extra bounce makes him miss the shot
tossed up just outside off, defended
good length outside off stump, walks towards the off side and defends the ball towards mid on
short outside off stump, Blackwood anticipates the spin, and goes towards the leg side to make further room. Punched off the back foot, but straight to cover
good length just outside off, goes deep into the crease and defends firmly
short on off stump, shuffles towards the off side and glances the ball past the square-leg umpire's right for a single
full outside off, drives the ball through it's line. Offered the bat's full face, and was timed nicely too. Straight to mid off, though
full on middle and leg, tried to show the bat's full face in his defense, but takes the outside part of his blade. Dribbles away towards the off side.
short and wide outside off, slower ball too, and Blackwood is not interested to play at it
back of a length outside off once again, 130kph this time though. Shoulders his arms
back of a length on middle stump, straightens after pitching, and Hope tries to pull out of his leg-glance, hits his glove, and his thigh, but falls just in front of short-leg
back of a length on middle, this time he can time it well. Worked past short leg's right
back of a length on middle, whipped off his pads, but straight to midwicket
good length on middle, uses his wrists well to work the ball fine on the leg side
short on leg stump, shuffles to the off side and pulls it. It's in the air, but goes one-bounce to fine leg, who is placed slightly square
darted full outside leg stump, Blackwood lets it go and the keeper does well to hold onto that
tossed up full on middle and leg, prods forward and defends the ball from near the ground. Ensures the ball doesn't go into the air
flatter, good length on middle, spins away from the right-hander, defended

tossed up on middle stump, he tries to defend off the front foot, but the ball wasn't interested to make any contact. Flies just past his outside edge and through to the keeper. Classic legspinner's ball
full on middle, driven to mid on
good length on off stump, topspin this time, the batsman has to tiptoe to defend

Stumped? The keeper is appealing. Pitched full on middle and leg, turns past his outside edge and the keeper grabs quickly, and removes the bails. He thinks it's a stumping, but the decision lies with the third umpire. Awaiting replays. Blackwood came forward to defend, but his back foot is dragged out of the crease. The aware Chakabva dislodged the bails instantly. The back foot is on the line (and not behind) when the stumps were broken. Aaaand he's given out! Blackwood's gotta go.
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, goes deep into the crease and taps the ball towards the leg side
full on middle and off, no real spin and allows Hope to defend off the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, gets inside the line of the ball and whips the ball past square leg for a single
tossed up full outside off stump, Dowrich defends it well, anticipated the amount of spin perfectly
full outside off once again, an expansive drive off the front foot, but straight to cover
back of a length on middle, spins away from the right-hander, who steps back and punches straight through to Cremer
good length on off stump, Hope shoulders his arms, but ensures his body was in front of the stumps. Bounce on offer and the keeper collects smartly
full on middle, defended back to the bowler off the  front foot
tossed up full outside leg stump, gets his backfoot out of the way and driven to mid on
short and wide outside off, spins further away. Can't make the connection he was looking for, cut to the sweeper fielder
good length on middle, and it's a beaut. Turn and bounce after pitching and goes juuust past the outside edge of his attempted back-foot defense
good length on leg stump, played quite square on the leg side off the back foot. Good use of his wrists
flat on middle stump, very poor delivery. Pulled easily over midwicket for four. No one there covering the deep. The ball held on after pitching but Dowrich is off the mark
tossed up full just outside off, defended with soft hands
full outside off, defends it once again
a glorious drive! full outside off and driven on the up past cover's right. Mire gives it a chase, and ensures that he saves a few runs
good length on middle stump, steps back to make room and free his arms, but can only shovel the ball to mid on

full on middle stump and this one goes straight through, Dowrich tries to defend the ball that would've been a traditional legspin, but this one had no such turn. Raps him on the pad and Cremer is excited. The appeal for lbw is turned down. So what? Zimbabwe review anyway Well, it's going down the leg side. Not out.
short on middle, backs away and plays a pull towards cow corner for four more. He's in an aggressive mood
full just outside off, brings out the square drive, but straight to point
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, legspin, enough room for Dowrich to pull it towards the leg side. Not timed well, though. Goes to mid on
short and wide on off stump, spins further away and cut to point
bang! Flight from Raza, on middle and leg. Right in Hope's wheelhouse, he clears his front leg, and then heaves waaay over midwicket. Longest part of the ground
quick around off, defended
slowed up on middle and leg, Hope gets right forward to defend
shortish down leg, Hope watchfully gets over the bounce to keep it down towards leg gully
short on middle and leg, worked away towards short leg. Playing with the spin
short again, on middle and leg, worked away through square leg. West Indies get to 200
lots of flight outside off, driven away towards cover
nice length, shortish and slow outside off, played away into the off side
plenty of flight outside off, Hope drives but gets a thick outside edge, flies off the outside half towards third man for two
nice loop on middle and leg, Hope strides right to the pitch to smother the ball
on middle and leg, off the outside half towards point
quick on the pads, 83 kph, Hope is watchful in defense
yorker from Williams, there was that much flight. Jammed out.
overly full again, easily pushed to mid-on
short and straight, that was quick, worked to midwicket

edged and gone! Quick around off, but Dowrich gets forward, the ball takes the outside edge and lobs straight to slip. It's another wicket for a spinner, just enough turn for Williams to take the shoulder of the bat, some extra bounce too. Fantastic delivery. Dowrich's horror form continues
a low full toss down leg, driven to mid-on
85 kph, quick on off, Holder defends confidently
lots of flight on middle, a thick inside edge into the leg side.
plenty of flight on leg, driven back to the bowler
more flight outside off, Hope gets forward and strokes a drive to the sweeper cover
short outside off, the ball spins away and beats the bat. Holder went chasing but bailed out very late
beauty! Slow on off, Holder gets forward and defends, but the ball spins past the edge. Lovely pace
a low full toss on leg, driven back to the bowler
quick outside off, Hope plays the line, the ball spins away, takes the edge and dies in front of slip
more flight outside off, driven to cover
quick around middle and leg, driven back to the bowler from the back foot
the slider! All hands on heads. Short outside off, the ball pitches on off and goes on. Juuuuuust enough spin to miss the off stump. Phew
right forward to defend this
short outside off, darted in outside off, defended awkwardly, but ably
beautiful legspin. Slow on off, Holder is drawn forward and the ball rips past the outside edge

the googly! Holder had no idea, the ball ripped back in and hit him in front of leg and middle. Only height would have saved Holder. Hmm, that looked close. No, says ump Dharmasena. Missing the stumps
shortish outside off, defended into the off side
fine shot that, overpitched outside off, Holder makes room and drills a drive past cover for four. Too full, allowing Holder to drive without much hassle
81 kph, the googly outside off, hit back to the bowler again. Not quite read
lots of flight outside off, when there is that much flight, Holder can use his long reach, gets close enough to the ball and drills his drive through cover. Another fine shot

just short of slip. The thing with this pitch is that it's not spinning extravagantly, but it's turning, which makes that spin even more dangerous. Flight on off, the ball spins away, takes the edge and falls just short of Masakadza at slip. He isn't sure, but it definitely bounced
quick and straight, Hope hurries back and defends watchfully
shortish outside off, guided off the back foot to point
pushed through, quick in the air outside off, pushed to the sweeper cover
flight on middle and off, Holder gets forward to defend

out, lbw or caught? Holder wants to review, that means he feels he did not hit the ball. Quick on middle and leg, the ball spun to beat Holder's flick. No bat. Now, all comes down to HawkEye. It's quick on leg, and it seems unlikely the ball will miss leg stump. All it needs to do is pitch in line and clip the leg stump. But there also seems to be some bat as the ball passes. There was a catch at gully, but did that carry? Three reds on HawkEye, but it seems there is definitely bat. The third umpire thinks there is no bat, but there was some spike with the ball kissing the edge. Hmm, interesting. Holder lbw. Don't think that's the right decision though.
flight outside off, driven towards cover
too short on leg, the googly, drops short and Hope picks the length, goes back and swivels into a fine pull through square leg. That's four more.
shortish and wide outside off, pushed to the sweeper cover
flight outside off, worked to mid-on
nicely tossed up outside off, Bishoo gets forward to defend
more flight on leg, spins past Bishoo's flick, struck on the pad
short around off, it's intentionally shortish to allow the ball to turn, played towards cover
nicely forward to defend
quick again, around off, Hope goes back to defend
generous flight on leg, driven with the spin to mid-off for one. Quality single
shortish outside off, the ball spinning back in, Bishoo goes back to defend the ball back

another one. Worked straight into short leg's hands. Quick delivery outside off, the ball spinning in. Bishoo can't help himself from nudging the ball with the spin, he didn't keep it down or hit it hard enough to make the catch harder. But Craig Ervine stays low and takes a wonderful catch, his eyes on the ball right through, takes it in front of him
lots of flight outside off, driven to the sweeper cover for one, takes him to 90
the googly, hits the inside edge onto the body and almost trickles back to hit the off stump. Didn't quite pick it, looked to drive, creating a big gap between bat and pad
a short legbreak outside off, Roach plays the line, the ball takes the leading edge towards cover.

Roach uses West Indies' last review. The googly, on middle and leg, hits Roach in front of leg, the ball then bobbles back to hit the face of the bat. There was definite bat, but it was after the ball hit the pad. So HawkEye will decide this. Three reds on HawkEye and Roach is gone now. West Indies are nine down. WI have exhausted their reviews.

79 kph, it is the googly and West Indies are all out. It rips back in, Gabriel plays the line, the ball spins back in, bounces extra and the ball takes the inside edge and bobbles to short leg. Another sharp catch from Ervine. That leaves Hope 90*
full and wide to start from Gabriel. Not much swing, left alone
good length delivery on leg, the ball seams back in, hits Masakadza on the pad, and then towards square leg
full and wide outside off, too wide to draw a stroke. Masakadza will be happy with that
the inducker. Full and wide outside off, but the ball seams in. Masakadza leaves, close to that off stump
full delivery outside off, maybe too full, driven away towards mid-off
good length on off, defended into the off side. A maiden to start
full around off, some seam movement back in, defended to mid-on
good length around off, moving back in, defended back
goes through the gully region for the first runs of the innings. Wild cheers from the crowd. Good length outside off, guided past gully for four
nails this. The adrenaline pumping through. Short outside off, way outside off actually, but he pulls and swats the ball over midwicket for four.
full and wide, too wide, left alone, an ODI wide
full around middle and leg, played quietly towards mid-on for a quick single
a yorker outside off, Mire jams that back to the bowler
short and wide, some seam movement back in.  Mire doesn't hold back, chops towards point. Wanted to hit that on the up
good length delivery around off, defended towards mid-on. Nice and watchful
fullish outside off, Mire right behind the line to defend
139 kph, full delivery outside off, Mire watches the ball onto the bat and defends
off the outside half for a couple to third man. Good length delivery outside off, Mire plays the line, the ball squirts off the outside half
a bit of flight around off, defended back
slightly short, Masakadza hurries back and pushes the ball into the off side
punched to extra cover from the back foot
lots of flight on off, driven to mid-off
shortish around off, defended into the off side
loads of flight outside off, Masakadza gets forward and smothers the ball
loads of flight, ends up as a yorker, jammed out into the off side
short down leg, Mire doesn't bother with that. A free ball

wheeeee, that's a massive six in the last over of the day. Smile away. Chase gives this some flight, Mire runs to the pitch, doesn't quite get there but the ball is in his arc so he swings through the line, the ball goes waaay over midwicket, out the ground.
flight around off, defended under his eyes. Boo
quick down leg, Mire looks to sweep, but the ball takes the pad and passes leg gully for some runs
short outside off, pushed into the off side. And that's stumps
back of a length just outside off, jumps onto the batsman. Defended, rather unconvincingly, off the back foot, towards short cover
short and wide outside off, crunched! Gets in position early, and pulls past midwicket for a boundary. Gets off the mark
adjusts his line, back of a length outside off and angled into the batsman. Driven straight back to the bowler
good length on off stump, gets inside the line of the ball and defends off the back foot

back of a length on off stump, angles into Masakadza once again. Mistimes the backfoot defense. Played down the wrong line as the ball goes down the leg side, raps him on the pad, but would've gone down leg stump
good length on off stump, can't get bat to ball as the delivery comes onto his body.
back of a length outside off stump, tiptoes and drops his hands onto the ball, allows the single as the ball goes towards short cover
back of a length just outside off, opens the bat's face and allows it to come to him, glanced to third man

induces the edge, but short! full outside off, straightens slightly after pitching, tries the front-foot defense, but the ball takes his outside edge instead. Falls just short of first slip, and then bounces away past him
back of a length outside off stump, gets inside the line of the ball and defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, tries to punch that towards mid off, but there's no feet movement. Mistimes it, as the ball hits the toe end of his bat
short outside off, defended off the back foot from top of off stump. Was rising onto him
short outside off, but not much bounce this time. Punched off the back foot, from in front of his pads, to mid on
full on off stump, tapped to mid on off the front foot

short and wide outside off, gets on top of the delivery and cuts between cover and point. The fielders have to give it a chase, and Jermaine Blackwood (who's very fast) does well to pull it back from near the ropes
good length on middle, the ball drifts down the leg side and the batsman can't flick it towards the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, the angle forces Masakadza to defend it from just outside off. Had to get onto his toes for that
good length outside off, defended off the back foot with ease
good length outside off, opens the bat's face and tapped towards gully. A fine dive to his right from the fielder positioned there to stop the ball

full and wide outside off, the batsman pushes at it but takes the wide edge off the bat, and flies past gully's right for four more. The batsman might just have opened the bat's face on purpose, though
full just outside off, firmly defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, stays slightly low, along with some inward movement into Mire. Ball goes through bat and pad and through to the keeper. No footwork once again
back of a length on off stump, Mire does well to defend it back to the bowler. Was quick to identify the ball's line
short and wide outside off, punches the ball away from his body, but the bat's face is opened. The ball races past point for another boundary to end the over. Rather expensive this
full just outside off, driven down the ground past the non-striker but mid on is up to the challenge. Races to his right, and dives full length to stop the ball from going for four
full on off stump, rocks back and defends back through to the bowler
full on off stump, shuffles to the off side and punches the ball down the ground. Mid on has to move one step to his left and collects
falls just short! Full on off stump, but uneven bounce this time, the ball hits the top sticker area of the bat, and pops up. Falls just short of Roach. Spongy bounce
good length outside off, defended off the back foot
short outside off and that's dispatched! Pulled emphatically past midwicket's left towards cow corner for another boundary to end an over. Masakadza getting a move on today
full on off stump, firmly defended back to the bowler
back of a length just outside off, tentatively punched towards cover, but takes the inside edge, goes past the stumps behind square on the leg side. Scampers through for the run
fuller outside off stump, defended towards cover off the front foot. Was quick to get to the pitch of the delivery
back of a length outside off, the batsman had wound up early for the punch past cover, but the ball took ages to get to him. Finally tapped towards the off side.
glorious! It's a half volley outside off stump and Masakadza settles quickly onto the front foot and hits a crunching cover drive. Races away
short on off stump, goes down the leg side
short outside off, goes for the big pull, but misjudges the pace completely. The ball goes under his bat, and through to the keeper
full outside off, defended off the front foot with ease
full outside off, punched down the ground but straight to mid off
short outside off, pulled, but straight to midwicket. The fielder has a shy at the non-striker's stumps, but misses. Would've been a close call if he would've hit

And the slower ball works! Mire's debut innings ends. Full outside off and Mire, rather frustratedly, slogs it towards the leg side. The elevation is there, but not the distance, and Kraigg Brathwaite at deep midwicket does well to settle under the ball early and falls to his knees as he completes the catch. Nice change-up from the experienced bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, can't time the drive well, and the bat turns in his hand. Dribbles away towards midwicket
full and wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, shuffles to his left and tucked towards the leg side off the front foot
good length just outside off, prods forward and confidently defends off the front foot. Gabriel using the wide crease to get the extra angle in
full just outside off, Ervine considers playing at it, but realises he's in no position to play it well. Pulls out of a drive, and goes through to the keeper.
not a genuine half-volley but Masakadza simply blasts this through the line. Races to the cover boundary. Not much movement, so it is a safe shot. Superb when it comes off

lands short of first slip. Looks to drive again on the up, checked his shot at the last moment. Looked like the ball stopped on him just a touch. This is a slow surface so it doesn't carry to the catcher. Lucky break for Masakadza
slower and fuller outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
snakes a length ball back into middle and leg, Masakadza gets a thick inside edge down to square leg
beauty. Plays inside the line of the delivery and watches it through to the keeper. This was a length ball that zipped through from off stump
on a length, just outside off, left alone. Hardly carries to the keeper this time
length ball that stops on him just a touch, Masakadza cautiously defends
yorker-length just outside off, Masakadza squeezes it back down the pitch
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, Masakadza gets a good stride forward and defends solidly
saved by an inside edge. Plays all around a full delivery angling in. Looked to work it through midwicket when he could've been better off playing through mid-on
stands tall and bunts this incoming length delivery with soft hands
solidly defends an incoming length ball to the off side
floats a back of length delivery across the left-hander, who lets it go
full and just outside off, eased back to the bowler
excellent line and length. Full on the stumps, draws the batsman forward. Carefully defended back down the pitch
steers an away-going length ball towards gully. Played this with soft hands
back of length delivery slanting away, is trying to get the batsman poke with an angled bat. Ervine isn't the one to be perturbed or poke nervously at the moment
once again invites the drive by pitching this up outside off, Ervine is happy to leave
sees the ball in his arc and he's muscled this over long-on. Too full, drifting into middle from wide of the crease and he simply got to the pitch of the ball and let the bat swing do the rest
immediately shortens his length. This is too short, slapped to sweeper cover
much better from Bishoo. Lands this a touch ahead of length on middle, hint of turn as Ervine lunges forward and defends
tossed up but this one pitches on leg stump and spins back in further, Ervine misses an attempted tickle
nicely tossed up on the stumps, defended with soft hands
nice flight, lands this on middle, he gets a good stride forward and turns this with the spin to the leg side
angles a length ball on the stumps from wide of the crease, bunted back down the pitch
punched to the diving gully fielder. This angled back in and cramped him for room as he shaped to cut
lands this a touch ahead of length on off, this one nips away just a hint. Masakadza is half-forward as he defends
shows the full face of the bat and drives this full-length delivery back to the bowler
crisp drive down to deep cover
stands tall and defends this incoming length ball with soft hands
nice flight and drift in from wide of the crease, Masakadza gets forward and defends
too short, he uses the depth of the crease to steer this into the gap at deep point. Enough time to come back for the second as Kraigg Brathwaite had to come around from deep cover
right forward as he defends
driven with the spin to the bowler
much fuller and outside off, defended back to the bowler
loaded with risk but when it comes off, it is effective. Full on middle, Masakadza plays a predetermined paddle to fine leg
full and just outside off, eased into the gap at cover for an easy single
nicely forward as he solidly defends this incoming length ball
looks to flick a full incoming delivery but misses. Even a hint of bat on that and it would've raced to the fine leg boundary. Holder lucky to get away with a wayward delivery
hint of movement from length outside off, left alone
snakes back in from wide of the crease, looks to flick but gets a thick inside edge to deep backward square leg
jags back in from length outside off, defended
tossed up on off stump, Ervine lunges forward and blocks
delightful flick. Chips down the track and whips this away over midwicket. Didn't quite get to the pitch of the ball but the momentum allowed him to complete the stroke
sharp turn back in from outside off, hits him high on the thigh pad as he looks to work this to the leg side
defends carefully with soft hands, lands short of short leg
this is a full-blooded sweep but smashes into the boot of short leg as he looks to take evasive action. Lobbed up briefly towards short fine. Would've been a remarkable catch had it been taken
steps out and eases the tossed up delivery down to mid-on
much fuller and just outside off, defended
slower and fuller on the stumps, squeezed back to the bowler
whips this incoming delivery on middle and leg to mid-on
driven firmly to mid-off where Kemar Roach dives and parries it to mid-on. Saved a couple of runs at least
carefully defends this incoming length ball from around the stumps
angles in a length ball that straightens a touch, defended solidly
full on off stump, carefully defended with soft hands
full outside off stump, the batsman settles down on one knee and sweeps square

full on middle and Ervine decides to sweep as well. It's in the air, but falls just over the short fine-leg' fielder. Not timed as well, and top edged too, but just enough muscle in that for the ball to go for four
back of a length on off stump, races down the ground but can't get to the pitch of the ball, bunted down the ground
fullish outside off, tries to cut it, but takes the top part of the bat. Slightly in the air but falls just short of point
good length outside off, punched past point and cover for an easy single. Goes deep into the crease
short outside off, gets inside the line of the delivery and pulls to the fielder at deep backward square
full outside off, and punched to mid off
back of a length outside off, tries to punch down the ground, but opens the bat's face at the last moment. Goes down to third man .
short and wide outside off, nice carry through to the keeper. Left alone

full and wide outside off, goes for the expansive drive, but the ball goes slightly away after pitching. That means Ervine misses the shot, and the ball goes juuuuuust past his outside edge. Holder has his hands on his head
good length just outside off, driven down the ground
full outside off, driven down the ground, sharp legspin
full on off stump, Masakadza biffs the ball to long off before the ball could spin away. Got to the pitch of it
full outside off, gets his front foot forward, and works it towards midwicket

pitched up just outside off and that is slogged! Gets down on one knee, and smacks it in front of square on the leg side. It's in the air, but the sweeper-fielder who is just behind square, has no chance. Bishoo getting some hammering here
full on leg stump, but Ervine was ready for it. Adjusts into the reverse-sweep, and gives the ball a nice swipe. Goes past point-region for four more. No chance for the left-hander's third man
full on off stump, squeezed away to mid on
short on off stump, rises onto his body, as he fends the ball towards the leg side. If there was a short leg for that delivery, he was a goner
short outside off and this time he has the width to pull it along the ground for a single
full outside off stump, the angle takes the ball away from Ervine. He lets it go
back of a length on middle and leg, Ervine lets that go through to the keeper but the delivery was very close to top of off stump. A good leave in hindsight, but rather close
full on off, driven to mid off along the ground. A good diving effort to stop the runs

And spin does the trick! Full on off stump and Masakadza comes forward for the defense. But extra spin on offer this time, and it takes a small edge off his bat. Dowrich does well to hold on to it. Feather touch, but good enough for the wicket. His watch has ended
full outside off, defends it first ball. Rather tentative, but gets the job done
full on off stump, lesser rip this time, gets inside the ball's line and plays it back through to Bishoo
tossed up full on middle and leg, defended
full on middle, pushed back and almost past Bishoo, but the bowler does well to stop the ball from going past him
back of a length on middle, rocks back and punches the ball to mid on
short outside off, Ervine ducks as the ball goes past his helmet
full on off stump, tries to defend but takes the inside edge instead
full just outside off, defended with soft hands from top of off stump
full outside off, tries to defend again but opens the bat's face at the last moment. Dribbles away to second slip, who has to dive to his left to stop the ball
full just outside off stump, Ervine shoulders his arms. It was on the fourth-stump line and the batsman calculated the distances well
short on off stump and this time it's got more pace. Ervine does well to get out of the way, ducking and shuffling his way towards the off side. Sharp take from Dowrich
full just outside off, driven down the ground to mid off
full on middle stump, gets to the pitch of the delivery and taps the ball along the ground to long on for a single

And Taylor lasts only seven balls! good length on middle stump and Taylor tries to play a reverse paddle sweep. First slip anticipated that shot and was already running to his right when Taylor makes contact. The shot isn't well timed, and sort of loops up instead. The fielder has to move a few steps to complete a very sharp catch. Zimbabwe in trouble
quicker ball to welcome Williams. Full on middle stump and goes straight through. Well defended by the new batsman
pushed wide outside off stump, forces the batsman to cut, but straight to the fielder at point
full on middle stump, too close to the body for a flowing drive, takes the bottom edge, and flies to the leg side. Unconvincing shot
full outside off, slashes at it and it takes the outside edge. Goes past slip for two more, as the infielders have to give it a chase
quick and full on middle and leg, misses the clip off his legs, and raps him on the pad. Gabriel appeals, but the umpire reckons it would've gone down leg. Replays confirm
back of a length just outside off, goes deep into the crease and punches back to the bowler
full on off stump, hurries onto Williams, who does well to keep the ball away from his pads. Bunted away to midwicket
good length on middle and leg, goes down the leg side but the batsman follows through with the shot, can't make contact though. Dowrich does well to dive to his right and collect the ball
full outside off, driven straight to cover
full on leg stump, tucked around the corner from near his toes
full on middle and leg, this time he connects with the sweep well. Goes straight to the square fine leg fielder
good length on middle, straightens after pitching and the batsman is playing the wrong line. Sneaks through between bat and pad, but a slight inside-edge saves the batsman from the lbw
full on middle, prods forward and taps the ball back to the bowler
good length just outside off, plays in front of square on the off side and calls early for a quick single. Big gaps in that region
full toss just outside off, pinged straight down the ground but Bishoo can get his body behind that shot. Gets away with the loose delivery
full on middle stump, tries to play the on drive, but the ball hits the outer edge of his bat, flies through towards mid off instead
full on leg stump, tapped to the fielder at midwicket. Minimal foot movement, while Gabriel continues to attack the stumps
full outside off, tentatively pushed to point. Looks for the single, but the fielder quickly throws it in

short on middle, and that's a ridiculous shot played by Williams. The height and pace challenges him, and he ducks to get out of the way, but his bat is hovering in the air, and it takes the inside edge. Goes through to fine leg for one
full on middle, almost a yorker and the batsman comes slightly forward, effectively yorking himself. Tries to flick the ball square but the inside edge off the bat through to his pads
full on leg stump, slightly awry line and that's tucked off his toes to backward square for two more. That's 100 for Zimbabwe, and also lunch.
tossed up outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
on the flatter side, sharp turn back into middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg
too full on the pads, worked wide of midwicket as they jog the single
laces this through cover. Lovely touch, lovely timing. Right to the pitch of the ball as he played the stroke
mistimes a drive to mid-off this time. Looked to hit it hard, didn't get it anywhere near the middle
much more authority in the drive, straight to mid-off though
floats this full on middle, Ervine defends from the crease when he could've perhaps looked to play forward
has he nicked this through? Muted appeal. Yorker-length outside off, Ervine looks to squeeze this through gully. Sound was that of the bat hitting the ground
touch fuller outside off, left alone
short and there's enough width as well for him to cut, but Ervine prefers to watch this through to the keeper
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
bunts this good length delivery on off with soft hands
too much flight, just around leg stump, worked to long-on
fired flat around leg stump, paddled down to fine leg. Neatly done
gives him the charge but he wasn't quite to the pitch of the ball. Looked to loft, goes off a thick inside edge to long-on
full and much closer to the stumps, defended with the bat close to his pad
too short, on middle and leg, whipped into the gap at midwicke

sharp turn back in to beat his forward prod. Big appeal and West Indies have reviewed. Shane Dowrich said 'not out.' Blackwood at short leg shoulted 'That's close, brother. That close!'. And so Holder reviews. Coming back to the delivery, this was nicely tossed up outside off, hit the surface and deviated back in to beat the inside edge and hit Ervine on the flap of the pad. Umpire's call and so since on-field wasn't out, this can't be given.
hint of reverse? Full outside off, this comes back in a wee bit. Defended from the crease

reverse swing has done the trick. Super lazy from Williams. Perhaps he was influenced by the deliveries that kept coming back in. This time, Roach got this length ball to move away from outside off, Williams had a waft at that and got a thin nick through to the keeper. West Indies are chipping away
floats this full on the stumps from wide of the crease, blocked carefully
angles a length ball on off stump, this one keeps a touch low, defended from the crease
bunts this carefully from the crease to the off side
looks to force this through cover, gets an inside edge and they scamper through for a single.
fired full on the stumps, paddled down to fine leg. Craftily done. He took it on the full
touch short and drifting in, he makes room and punches this down to mid-on
shapes to cut but tries to pull out of the stroke, the ball skews off the outer part of the bat to short third man
fired full, once again he isn't afraid to get across the stumps and paddle it down to fine leg
full on middle from wide of the crease, defended

Dowrich misses a stumping. Bishoo has all the reasons to be disappointed. He cleverly shortened his length and got the ball to break away as Raza shimmied down the pitch. Once he realised he wouldn't get to the pitch of the ball, he tried to pad it away but the ball spun away to brush the outside of his elbow and deflect off the keeper's glove to slip.
length on middle, defended from the crease
steps out and works this tossed up delivery with the spin to midwicket
width outside off, driven firmly on the up to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
gets this length ball to nip back in from outside off, punched back to the bowler
slower off-cutter on middle, Ervine picks it off the hand and blocks
gets this to nip away from outside off, watched through to the keeper
too short, he uses the depth of the crease to ease this into the gap at deep cover
steps out and turns this with the spin to midwicket
sliding down leg and he brings out a powerful sweep that beats short fine leg. That should break the shackles
gets a good stride forward and turns this with the spin to the leg side
skiddy delivery at length on off stump, keeps a touch low, defended from the crease
tossed up on middle, hint of turn back in, he lunges forward and smothers it
length outside off, gets this to nip away just a bit, defended from the crease
this one skids back in and keeps a touch low. Raza bottom-edges while defending from the crease
back of length delivery outside off, left alone
defends from the crease, gets a thick edge that rolls to gully
hops across as he defends this length ball outside off. Raza has looked extremely ungainly and ugly so far. But he's survived
full and in from wide of the crease, minimal feet movement again as he defends
turns it with the spin to short fine leg
leans into the stroke and works this with the spin towards long-on. The man there was ambling towards the ball, Raza spotted an opportunity and completed it.
rolls off a thick inside edge to short fine leg
whips this shortish delivery with the spin to short fine leg
breaks back in sharply to beat the inside edge and hit him on the back pad. No excitement because height would've been in question
gets a good stride forward and blocks
back of a length outside off stump, punched straight to cover
full outside off, Raza does well to jump inside the line of the ball, and defends it towards mid off. Ensured the body was behind the ball
full outside off stump, pinged straight to mid off once again
back of a length outside off, opens the bat's face and tries to play it behind square on the off side. But played slightly too fine.. second slip dives to his right and stops the ball.
back of a length outside off stump, the wide angle gets the ball into Raza's body. Hurries him, as he has to jump slightly to get his bat in front of the ball
good length outside off stump, stays really low as Raza lets the ball go
full on leg stump, swept well but straight to short fine leg
flatter on middle stump, rocks back deep into the crease and whips the ball behind square
tossed up full on leg stump, the batsman charges down the pitch, and defended

What have you done, Raza?! Flighted on off stump and the batsman's eyes lit up. Went for a big slog, trying to go over extra cover, but it's in the air. Shannon Gabriel runs in from long off and does the rest. For a while, though, the fielder had no clue where the ball was.
good length on middle stump, prods forward and defends but Bishoo is interested for an lbw. The umpire? Not so much
good length on middle stump, tapped down the ground to long on
back of a length outside off, stays slightly low, bunted towards cover. Unconvincing shot
good length on off stump, Waller carefully defends
full on leg stump, turns it away square towards the leg side. Midwicket has to chase, does well
back of a length just outside off, shuffles towards the off side and defends
fullish on middle stump, worked around his legs to fine leg. Calls early for two, and gets them
slower ball, full on middle, tapped past midwicket's right for some more runs. It was in the air momentarily, but the fielder wasn't near it
flighted full on middle, defended with soft hands
full just outside off, spins further away from the right hander, pushed towards cover
good length on middle, he goes deep into his crease and tries to flick it behind square on the leg side. Can't
full outside off, pushed towards point and calls early for the single. Misfield, and the ball goes past the fielder. Deep cover has to retrieve that. Sloppy stuff
flighted on middle stump, charges down and drives to mid off
tossed up full outside off, driven with the open face in front of square. Cover dives and misfields, allowing the batsmen to go through for the run
back of a length on middle stump, slower ball to start off, defended with soft hands
full and wide outside off, left alone by Waller
full on off stump, punched down the ground to mid off. Hit the bat near the sticker area
full on middle, gets inside the ball's line and defended
full just outside off stump, crisply driven down the ground. But mid off is there for that shot
full on off stump, slight inswing, bunted towards midwicket. Time for drinks.
