out first ball! full on middle stump and he misses the sweep completely. The ball went straight through, and that's plumb lbw. After consultation with Waller, Ervine decides not to review. Good decision.
full on off stump, carefully defended by Chakabva
full on leg stump, tucked down the leg side for a single. Slip has to run towards the boundary near fine leg to get the ball back. He's off the mark
flighted full just outside off stump, defended
full outside off, defended along with the spin
flighted just outside off once again, defends off the front foot and sees the over out
good length outside off stump, left alone by the batsman
back of a length outside off stump, angles into him, defends off the front foot and thinks about taking a single. The non-striker says no
back of a length outside off stump, tapped towards point and calls quickly for the single. The fielder dives to his right to stop the ball
full outside off stump, slight tail into the batsman's body. Brings out the front-foot defense
full on off stump, defended but takes the inside edge onto his boot. Chakabva displaying a solid defense technique
back of a length on middle stump, tucks it behind square, past the square-leg umpire's right, for another run
full on middle stump, defends the ball towards the fielder at short midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, rocks back going deep into the crease, and defended
full just outside off, defended along with the legspin on offer. Safe
Falls just short! Full on off stump, spins away from his defensive shot. Takes the outside edge, but just short of first slip
full on off stump, prods forward and defended with ease
full on middle and leg, gauges the line and length early this tine. Gets down on one knee and swats the ball square on the leg side. There's protection in the deep, though
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot this time. Nice use of the wide angle from the bowler to bring the ball back into Waller's body
short on off stump, 132kph and gets big on Waller. He has to tiptoe, and then drop his hands on the shot. Was very very deep in the crease. It means he was waiting for the short ball all this time
Cartwheel! Good length on off stump, Waller defends down the wrong line and the ball goes between bat and pad this time. Crashes into middle stump and the stick cartwheels away

short outside off, Cremer tries to poke at the ball and brings his bat back just in time. Juuuust goes past his outside edge. Very tentative stuff from the new man in. They almost considered going for a review for the caught-behind, but better sense prevailed eventually
full on off stump, a mistimed drive takes the ball to midwicket
full on middle, defended towards mid on to end the over
full on middle stump, steps forward and defends
flighted on off stump, and punished! Gets his front foot out of the way and hits that through the ball's line. Floats over long on for a maximum
tossed up again, on middle and leg, defended firmly
flatter this time, outside off stump, and spins away from his attempted back-foot defense. Keeper collects
good length on off stump, Turn and Bounce! Worked past point for a single
full on off stump and Cremer steps forward to defend, but it's a ripper. The ball goes just past his outside edge and through to the keeper, and Dowrich appeals! Not out
ducks under a short ball that hardly got up. Wasn't far from the stumps
excellent technique. Dropped his wrists and swayed out of the way of that short ball outside off
nice and full around off stump, squeezes this showing the full face of the bat
how did that miss the off stump? Bends back in a long way from length outside off as he gets it go. Holder can't believe it
squeezes a drive to mid-on off a thick inside edge
angles one back in from wide of the crease, Cremer defends but is overbalanced in doing so. No harm done though

turn, bounce and indecision in shot selection has resulted in Chakabva's downfall. Bishoo has five. He shapes to cut but the ball hits the rough and spins away. He pulled out of the cut at the very last moment but hung is bat out nevertheless as the ball skewed to Roston Chase at backward point
pushed through quicker. Gets this to bite away and beat his forward push
mistimes a pull that he fetches from way outside off
slow turn from off stump, punched back to the bowler
gets a good stride forward and blocks this full delivery
goes back and across to defend but this one drifts in and spins past the outside edge
back of length outside off, left alone
driven one bounce to mid-on. He picked the bones out of that. Uppish, but safe.
right behind the line of the length ball as he defends back to the bowler
gets this full delivery to reverse back in from wide of the crease, he plays outside the line and gets a thick inside edge

dragged on! He hid the shiny side as he ran in, bowled this full outside off, this wobbled away just a touch. Enough width which Cremer looked to use and flay through cover, only managed to drag it back onto the stumps. Should've looked to get closer to the ball, paid the price for poor technique
tossed up on middle and leg, eased to long-on
clever little paddle down to fine leg for two
prods outside the line of this googly, the inside edge rolls wide of short leg as they steal a single
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this tossed up delivery back to the bowler
sharp turn, spins past the face of the bat as he lets it go
defends a full delivery back to the bowler off the back foot
hits the deck hard and lands a length ball just outside off, defended firmly
yorker-length ball that swerves away late to square him up and roll off a thick outside edge
floats this full and just outside off, defends outside the line and gets a thick inside edge to short leg
right back into the crease as he defends this short of length delivery on off
right back and across as he defends this short ball with soft hands
flicks this half-volley on the pads to the deep square leg fence
on the shorter side, punched to cover
drifts into middle but the length is on the shorter side, defended off the back foot
spins past the face of the bat to whizz past the outside edge. Drawn forward by the flight
plays and misses, this one kept a touch low too. Played down the wrong line
slow turn from middle, defended with soft hands
fired full and outside off, left alone
wayward start. Slips in a full delivery down leg, keeper collects it low to his left.
tickles this incoming length ball down to fine leg
ducks under this short of length delivery outside off without too many hassles
ducks under this short of length delivery angling in towards his helmet. Whizzes past
looks to work this off his hip to square leg but the ball skids back in to hit him high on the thigh pad
nearly sneaked through. This one came back in a long way as he looks to whip it with the angle. Played outside the line again.
flatter one outside off, bunted back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, he lunges forward and blocks
eased down to mid-on this time
squared him up by the length. The drift and turn meant he was squared up. Wow, super stuff
yorker-length outside off, squeezed back towards the bowler
forced into the gap at sweeper cover
short ball on middle, angling in from wide of the crease, Mpofu ducks away and hears the ball whizz past his ears
hops across and defends this short ball angling in towards his ribcage
looks for a yorker, settles for a full-length delivery in the end. Defended back to the bowler
leans forward to drive, bunts it down with an angled bat to point
slower and fuller on the stumps, looks like he was winding up to go over the top. Ended up squeezing it out in the end
has he tickled this down leg? Hit something. Has to be the pad or the strap of the pad. Lucky to get away with that wayward delivery
back of a length just outside off, lets it go through
tossed up on middle stump, Jarvis prods forward but chooses not to play at it. Goes past his outside edge
Hoicked! But falls in no man's land. It was tossed up on off stump and Jarvis gives it a wild slog. The ball flies above the bowler's head and falls just in front of long off
flighted wide outside off, gives it a big swing and it's top edged. Flies over first slip for some runs. Full tail-ender batting going on right now
full on middle, defended off the front foot
tossed up full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid on.
full just outside off, tentatively defended, takes the inside edge and raps him on the pad, and almost goes through to the stumps. Almost

wide outside off, back of a length and Mpofu pokes at it. Good for him that there was no contact with bat. Goes just past his outside edge. No movement of the feet, and atleast a couple of yards between bat and pad
And that's the end! Zimbabwe are all out for 159. Back of a length outside off and this time Mpofu's poke catches the outside edge of the blade. Dowrich swallows that and we're done. Time for tea.
angles a full length delivery on off, Brathwaite plays outside the line and gets a thick inside edge down to deep square. Would've been a dead duck had he missed that.

leading edge that just lands short of Cremer coming in from mid-off. The slips and keeper went up for an lbw, but this one came off the leading edge as it swung back in late and held its line. What drama.
touch ahead of length on middle, gets the ball to move back in a hint, Powell defends tentatively. The ball thuds into his bat. Not much authority yet, isn't sure whether to play forward or back
floats this full and across the left-hander, who watches it through to the wicketkeeper
into the driving zone, just outside off. Powell shapes to drive but lets it go at the last moment
full and just outside off, gets this to move back in a wee bit. Excellent leave from Powell
squares him up with a ripper. Jags away from length ever-so-slightly to open him up as he looks to defend from the crease.
squared up again, this one's much fuller. He jabs at it and gets this down to point
angles in a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, bunted to mid-on
shapes to cut but lets this short of length delivery zip through instead
touch fuller, just around off, he shows the full face of the bat in defense
floats this full on off, Brathwaite jabs hard from the crease. Rolls to mid-off. Excellent first over
gets this length ball slanted across the left-hander, who shoulders arms
doesn't commit himself fully forward. Is on the move forward as he bunts this away-going length ball back down the pitch
squeezes this full delivery to Cremer at a straightish mid-off
laces this through cover. Not timed off the middle, the outfield is heavy too. Did well to get a good stride in and lace this into the gap
gets forward and negotiates this full delivery with his bat close to the pad
squeezes this full-length ball back to the bowler off a thick inside edge. Shaped to drive through covers, the ball swung back in late to roll off a thick inside edge.
looks to force this through point but the width isn't quite there, bunted to cover instead
works this from length outside off towards square leg
uppish but safe. Flicked down to deep square leg
shows the full face of the bat as he bunts this back of length delivery back to the bowler
back of length delivery that nips away a wee bit from middle, defended
through the gap at extra cover. Unafraid to hit on the up, didn't time it as well as he would've liked though
robotic lengths. Touch ahead of good length on off, defended back down the pitch
ripper of a delivery. Terrific seam presentation. Draws him forward, the batsman played for the one that shapes back in but this hit the seam and nipped away to beat the edge.
jags back in a long way but the length is on the shorter side. Enough time to adjust as he defends
checks his attempted flick at the last moment, lands short of short midwicket as a result
crunching on-drive but straight to mid-on in the end
squirted away between third slip and gully. Did well to loosen his grip to ensure it went all along the ground
back of length delivery that nips away off the seam, left alone

stunning off-drive. This is a length ball angling away, there's width. What does he do? Plant forward, hit through the line, in the process he's picked the bones out of it. Clears long-off quite effortlessly
angles in a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, defended
full and wide outside off, shapes to drive but decides to let it go in the end
full and angling in from wide of the crease, this pitches around off and moves away. Left alone
crunching drive to the man at extra cover
full and angling away from the left-hander, watched through to the keeper
slower and fuller on leg stump, he bunts this down to the man coming in from midwicket
flicks this full delivery from outside off to short midwicket
back of length delivery that jags away from outside off, left alone
driven straight down the ground, mid-on comes around to stop it
gets a good stride forward and eases this full-length delivery to mid-off
works this with the spin to short fine leg
drifting into middle and leg, turned to midwicket
jabs at that in-drifter, in the air but away from silly point
beaten! Drifts, hits the rough and spins away to whizz past the outside edge
driven firmly with the spin to mid-off. Took a bigger stride forward this time
rocks back and cuts this short ball straight to point. Scoring opportunity missed
it's full outside off, driven on the up down the ground to mid on. Timed really well
back of a length outside off once again, Powell lets it go through to Chakabva
good length just outside off on the fourth-stump line, Powell contemplates playing, but leaves it eventually.
back of a length outside off, rocks back and defends this off the back foot
back of a length outside off, gets inside the ball's line and defends it back to Jarvis
uses the wide angle well this time, full on off stump, forces Powell to get bat to ball. Punched back to the bowler
full on middle, no spin, bunted back to Williams
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length just outside off, shuffles towards the leg side and cuts the ball furiously. Forces silly point to jump and the ball goes to the fielder at point
good length outside off, Turn and bounce brings the ball too close to his body for the cut, misses

good length just outside off, extra bounce again, misses the cut, and the ball hits his handle, and lobs away towards the leg side. He will need to be careful though, many infielders surrounding the bat
full outside off, tries to drive but takes the outside edge, falls just in front of first slip
tossed up full on middle and leg, charges down the wicket and drives towards the on side. Midwicket dives and reduces the pace of the ball, and mid on races in and throws the ball back in.
full on middle stump, worked off his toes in front of square on the leg side. Beats midwicket, and the sweeper-fielder on the leg side.

His third wicket in five balls! He misses the hat-trick, but takes a wicket two balls later. It's full on off stump, expecting the legspin, but it goes straight through, curls around his outside edge, and then knocks the off stump out. Powell's done.
full on leg stump, somehow carves the ball behind square past first slip. But short third man is agile, and gets to it quickly. Ensures the run can't be taken and the new man stays on strike
Dropped! Full on middle, and Hope reaches towards the ball and tries to play it straight, the bat turns, and the ball goes straight to short leg. But he can't hold on.
full on middle and leg, gets into a tangle with the ball so close to his body, but manages to fend it away
full on leg stump, gets his front leg forward and defends
full on middle, defended
what a beauty! Full on middle, turns away slightly from the right-hander's defense, and goes just past offstump. The keeper can't hold on either
good length on off stump, straightens after pitching and for the second-straight ball he plays down the wrong line. Goes just past off stump and everyone is groaning
full on off stump, defended

back of a length on off stump and this one's the best of the lot. The batsman rocks back to try defending this off the back foot, but he misses again - almost fooling everyone that he edged - and Chakabva holds on to it in his second attempt.
full just outside off, defended with soft hands
Dances his way to a maximum! Tossed up on off stump and Brathwaite charges down! Dispatched over long on for six. Rather uncharacteristic from Brathwaite, but he connected well. Soars into the stands
full outside off, tucked in front of square on the leg side. They walk through for the single
good length on off stump, forces Hope to hurry back and defend off the back foot
full on leg stump, charges down and drives the ball past mid on's right for four more. Gets off the mark as well.
flighted full on leg stump, carefully defended to end the over
good length on middle stump, straightens, can't get bat to ball
full on middle and off, comes forward and defends it back to Williams
