pretty full and slanting in at off stump, makes Chase play, and he does so, tapping to cover
back of a length and outside off, Chase goes after this delivery, punching it straight to backward point with an open face
banged in short on middle, Chase gets inside the line and smartly pulls it away to deep square leg. He hares back for the second. Excellent running between the wickets
back of a length and outside off, jabbed away towards the gully region
variable bounce, again! Very full and scoots low at shin height, the batsman stoops low with it and keeps it out
this is short and rises outside off, Hope does well to get on top of the bounce and flay it away through the covers
very full and outside off, Hope eyes up a booming drive but does not meet the pitch of the ball. Ends up jabbing the ball only as far as mid-off
full and shoots low at off stump, well negotiated by Hope. This pitch is playing many tricks. Beware, batsmen
Hope stands up tall, meets this short one outside off, and punches through the line to mid-off. Lovely high elbow, but he forgot about placement
good length and outside off, Chase prefers to shoulder arms
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Chase opens the face and dabs it to backward point
full and outside off, Chase presses forward and drives it on the up to cover
back of a length and heading towards the top of off, Chase punches it firmly to backward point

Mpofu belts out a big appeal for lbw, umpire Dharmasena does not budge. This was very full and swinging into the leg stump. Chase eyes up a flick and falls over, missing the ball. But this seemed to be heading down the leg side. It would have missed a set of stumps down leg
full on middle, patted back down the pitch
full and angling in at off stump, worked away to short midwicket
full and skidding in at off, Hope stops it in its tracks
good length and outside off, swings away further, no shot
banged in short and outside off, only 125ks, Hope has all the time in the world to swivel-pull it away to deep square leg
good length and holds its line on off, Chase pats it down near his feet
shot, Chase! Overpitched and outside off, Chase uses his long reach and crunnnnnnnches it between the covers and mid-off. So easy on the eye...
near yorker on middle, Hope brings his bat down in time and squeezes the ball to short midwicket
short and wide outside off, Hope loses his patience. He slashes a fair way away from the body and watches the ball beat the outside edge
really full on off stump, the batsman can't get under it. He jams the ball out to mid-off
straying into the pads, neatly picked off to the man manning the midwicket boundary
banged in short on the leg stump, cramps Chase for room, but he still manages to tickle an attempted pull to the left of the keeper. The ball rolls to the fine-leg boundary
pitched up on a fifth-stump line, Chase solidly blocks it

Kyle Hope: lbw b Jarvis. Shai Hope: lbw b Jarvis. Reiffel, the umpire, raises his finger. Shai calls for a review. Back of a length and skids back in to smack the flap of the front pad, beating the inside edge. The tracker suggests it would go onto hit the leg stump. West Indies lose Shai Hope and a review
just short of a good length on off, stabbed to mid-on off the inside half
back of length outside off, he's on top of the bounce as he punches to cover
width outside off and he's crashed this to the point boundary. Easy pickings
angling into the pads, tickled to fine leg
drifting down the leg side, Chase stretches out and sweeps it away fine. Easy peasy
short and breaks away outside off, Chase reaches out and slashes it away to backward point
Williams puts it on a length outside off and gets it to spin away, ignored

length ball, drifts in on off, makes Blackwood poke at it, and beats the outside edge. Has Williams left Blackwood overbalanced? A stumping chance has been sent upstairs. Yes, Blackwood is overbalanced, and has no part of the back foot behind the crease. Casual effort from Blackwood but WI's lead approaches 300
short delivery, arm ball, arrows in on middle, swatted off the back foot past midwicket
slower and full on off, Dowrich presses forward and push-drives the ball to mid-off
shot, Roston! Looped up on off, he gets underneath the length and launches it nice and clean over the long-off boundary. Bang
full on the stumps, eased down to long-on
tossed-up legbreak just outside off, tight leave
dangled up on off stump, dead batted
pushed through flatter and quicker on middle, blocked
Cremer throws this up on off stump, full ball, the batsman clips it away to mid-on
darted in on middle, length ball, Chase blocks off the back foot
skids in on middle, chipped over short leg
pushed through on middle, defended
lobbed up on middle, played back to the bowler
back of a length on off, punched to cover
round-arm slider, fizzes in to catch the thigh pad
slides in on off, blocked
flat and darted into the pads, whipped away behind square on the leg side
a bit too full and outside off, Dowrich stretches forward and crunnnnnnches it through the covers. Lovely flow of the arms into the drive. That blow takes the lead past 300
tossed up on middle, defended
dangled up on off, defended
tossed on off, the batsman stays leg side of the ball and drives it crisply past mid-off
short and outside off, scythed to backward point

Dowrich nicks off to slip. Dangled up outside off and breaks away, Dowrich spars at it, and edges it low to first slip, where Hamilton Masakadza, who had dropped one in the morning, bends low to snap it up
launches this over long-off. Woah, what a first strike. Saw this tossed up, cleared his front leg and hammered this over the ropes. Got that bang in the middle
width and he's crashed that into the extra cover boundary. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but there was room to free his arms. Has he decided attack is the best form of defense?
right to the pitch of the ball as he drives inside-out to Cremer at cover. The Zimbabwe captain threw the ball up in the air to celebrate a crowd catch. They don't buy into it
lunges forward and blocks
short of a length on off stump, Chase opens the face and quietly taps it towards point
chest-high short ball on middle, Chase reads it well, swivels on the back foot and places a pull to the left of long leg
pitched up and outside off, Chase is now right forward to drive on the up to cover. His footwork is so precise
full on off, Chase presses forward and drives the ball straight back to Jarvis
full and on a fourth-stump line, crisply driven through the line to mid-off
pitched up and angling into the drives, Chase drives again, this time off the inside half to the right of mid-on
fired wide outside off, Chase lets it go
floated full and outside off, slices a drive to backward point
short and wide outside off, turns away further, Chase reaches out for the ball and slaps it away to the off-side sweeper
straight ball on middle, defended with a straight bat off the front foot
tossed on middle, Holder stays leg side of the ball and caresses it to extra cover
on a length and outside off, flat-batted to long-off

full on middle, Holder presses out, uses his long reach and drives it superbly straight down the ground. Cremer chases the ball hard from mid-on, slides near the edge of the boundary, and scoops the ball back into the field of play. A+ for commitment, skip!
back of a length and nips back in, deflected behind to the keeper
nice and full outside off, Chase drives without meeting the pitch of the ball, and is beaten on the outside edge
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and dabs the ball to gully
good length on off stump, presses forward and bunts the ball to short cover
back of a length and angling into a tight back-foot defence to mid-on
drifts in from around the wicket and turns, Holder pokes it out towards point
darted in on middle, Holder defends to the left of short leg
pushed through on middle, hastily blocked to short leg again
tossed on off, defended off the front foot to cover
short and darted in, inside-edged onto the front pad
tossed on middle, Holder stays leg side of the ball and drives a single to long-off
really full on off, Holder clears his front leg, winds up, and thrashes it straight to mid-off
slower offcutter from Jarvis, 110ks, hoodwinks Holder, and zips past the inside edge. It wasn't far away from the top of off either. Cracking change-up
back of a length on the stumps, hit to the right of mid-on
another slower cutter outside off, Chase delays his whip and sends it to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and dabs it through backward point. Chase hares back for the second and makes it
tight line on off, Chase is tight in defence as well
arrowed in at leg stump, Holder blocks to short leg
slower through the air on off, Holder opens the face and runs it behind point
looped up on middle, dead-bat defence from Holder
low full-toss on off, bunted down to long-off
short and fizzes in to ping the thigh pad
tossed up on middle, Holder welcomes his opposite number back into the attack with a one-bounce four to the wide long-on boundary. What a smooth swing

Holder eyes up an encore, dares to hit against the break, and ends up slicing a catch to the left of point. Looped up and spins away, this time Cremer foils Holder's attempt to blast it over the leg-side boundary
short on off, Bishoo defends off the back foot
pushed through on the leg stump, defended to short leg
slower through the air on middle, opens the face and guides it to cover
flat and skids back in from around the wicket, Bishoo plays all around it and wears it on his thigh
really full on off, pushed away to long-on
low full-toss outside off, driven to the right of mid-off. Mpofu dives to his right and half-stops the ball
on a length and spins in, Bishoo capably blocks to cover
slog-swept from outside off to deep square leg
mighty full on leg stump, jabbed away to long-on
spins into the pads , glanced away to fine leg
dangled up outside off, slog-swept across the line to midwicket
Cremer drops this legbreak short on off, Bishoo picks the length up early. Rocks back and smacks a pull over mmidwicket
dangled up outside off, Bishoo wafts and misses, the keeper is beaten as well
really full on middle, squeezed to the covers
short and turns away outside off, Chase stands tall and forces it down to long-off. He brings up a fifty, off 69 balls
full and outside off, eased down to long-off
length ball, grips, spin, and brushes the pad
skids into the pads, whipped away to long leg
on a length and outside off, guided to backward point
tossed up, defended on off stump
low full-toss on off, caressed down to long-off
slides in at off stump, Chase sits back and whips it to wide long-on
short and wide outside off, Bishoo cracks a cut straight to extra cover
bunted to cover again
dropped short and wide outside off, Bishoo can't find the gap on the off side
offbreak, grips, and turns past the iffy prod
short and wide outside off, Bishoo rocks back and flays a cut past backward point but the ball plugs in the deep
floated up outside off, driven to the right of mid-off
slower legbreak outside off, too close to cut, Chase chops an inside edge onto the pad
poked to the right of short leg as this full ball drifts in on middle. WI's second-innings score reaches 300
flat on the pads, defended
fired on middle and leg, blocked to short leg
Bishoo goes low and sweeps a single to fine leg
length ball, slides in on off, Bishoo blocks off the back foot
dangled up outside off, Bishoo stretches out and smites a slog-sweep to the midwicket boundary
full-toss on middle, tapped down to long-on
full and angling across off from around the wicket, run away to backward point
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
full-toss on middle, driven with the wrists to long-on
pushed through on middle, blocked to the leg side
straight ball on middle, Bishoo presses forward and blocks back to the bowler
flatter and faster on off, dead batted
chopped from off stump to backward point
tossed outside off, driven through the line to long-off
full and sliding across off, Chase leans into it and creams it to the cover boundary
back of a length on middle and leg, shovelled away to deep backward square leg
skids in on off, defended off the back foot
pushed through on off, quick fizzer, paddled away square on the leg side
flat and fast on off, kept out
full and angling across off, driven to cover, where short cover makes a tumbling save
nice flight, lands this just outside off, Chase gets forward and blocks
makes room and squeezes this full delivery back to the bowler
on the shorter side, punched down to long-on as he jogs the single
lunges forward and works it with the spin to long-on for an easy single
drifts in a quicker delivery on middle, he waits for the turn and blocks
mistimed drive straight to cover. Looked to go over the top but got it off the toe end of the bat
slow turn from off stump, Bishoo defends this from the crease
fires in a full delivery on the stumps from around the wicket, Bishoo is well forward as he smothers that
width and he crunches this short ball straight to extra cover
fired full on off stump, blocked again
nice flight and just around off again, Bishoo is well behind the line as he defends
makes room and punches this in-drifter to extra cover
too full outside off, squeezes the drive to long-off for a comfortable single
googly which he reads off the pitch because of slow turn, steers this past slip
drives inside-out to long-off for a comfortable single
sharp turn but the length is on the shorter side, he gets across the stumps and blocks
pulled handsomely. This was a poor ball. Enough time for him to open up the leg side and put that away towards deep midwicket
right to the pitch of the ball as he steers this down to long-off
slow turn back into middle, defended to the leg side
whips this from outside off towards square leg
punches this back to the bowler
top effort by Jarvis to stop a powerful drive at extra cover. Throwing himself full stretch to his left to save three runs for the side
punches this short ball down to long-off. Had to check his shot as the ball stopped on him
sliding down leg, he tickles this down towards fine leg to move into the 70s
muscles this over wide long-on. Down on one knee and put this away even though he didn't get underneath the flight. He was hitting it with the spin though, so it was a safe option
dabs this shortish googly to Masakadza at slip
gets right to the pitch of the ball and blocks
reads the googly off the hand this time. Gets well forward and eases the drive to cover
makes room and bunts this shortish delivery to cover. Hint of extra bounce from the rough outside off this time
squeezes this full-length delivery back to the bowler
too short, he makes room and punches this to cover
struck on the pad but this one spun back in sharply and would've missed the stumps
punches this down to long-on for an easy single
pushed through quicker on middle from around the stumps, defended back down the pitch
gets well forward and blocks
fired in from around the stumps, he gets forward and blocks
slow turn from off stump, he steers this past slip
gets well forward and defends this with the spin
nearly dragged on. Shaped to sweep from way outside off, got a thick under-edge onto the pad as it then deflected between the keeper's legs
whips this against the turn to mid-on as lead goes up to 400
slides one across Bishoo, who stretches forward and defends
slow turn back in from middle and off, turned with the spin to the leg side
late reverse back in from outside off, squeezed back down the pitch
width and he's thumped this on the up to the extra cover boundary. So good to watch. Deep point wasn't far from the ball but he didn't even bother moving
authentic off-drive to mid-off this time
steely wrists as he whips this over midwicket. This was a length ball slanting into the stumps and he picked it up beautifully
length outside off, steers this to gully
grip on the deck as this comes back in, he's cramped for room in an attempt to steer this behind. Awkwardly defended
shortens his length just a bit, Bishoo stretches forward and defends
mistimes a slog to mid-on. Looked to over the infield, couldn't get any power
works this with the spin to midwicket
slow turn from off stump, bunts this to deep point
driven firmly but can't pick the gap at cover
slow turn from around the stumps, defended back down the pitch
back of length on off, defended solidly
gets this to jag back in from length on middle and off, bunted to midwicket
gets this to nip away off the seam from length outside off, left alone
late away movement squares him up as the edge squeezes down past backward point
nice and full on the stumps from around the wicket, defended back down the pitch
solidly behind the line of this incoming length ball as he keeps it out
too full and drifting in, Chase gets forward and blocks
whips this into the midwicket region. Picked the gap between the two fielders there
sharp turn back in from around the stumps, carefully defended
too short and sliding in, swept with the spin to deep square leg
steers this into the gap behind point for an easy single
gets underneath the flight and lofts this cleanly over the bowler's head. Too much flight, his eyes lit up as he was down on one knee to put that away
angles in a length ball from around the stumps, punched back down the pitch
this is an excellent short ball angling in towards his rib cage, he awkwardly fends as this ball bounces in front of the keeper. Full marks for the effort
floats one full and just outside off, squeezes this out
shows the full face of the bat to belt that back down towards the bowler, who stops it on his followthrough
he's hoisted this from outside off towards the cow corner boundary. Length delivery, slower as well, he held his shape beautifully
gets on top of the bounce and defends this short of length delivery  with soft hands
slow turn back in from outside off, bunted to the off side
lobs off the thigh pad to short fine. Sharp turn from way outside off. Question was if he was offering a shot. Umpire Dharmasena thinks so
works this against the turn to mid-on, once again he's on the shorter side
quicker delivery drifting into middle, hurried into the stroke as he defends
jabs this with half-a-bat to the off side
well forward as he bunts this to the off side
slow turn back in from middle, defended back down the pitch
great shot. Down on one knee as he slog sweeps on the bounce to the deep midwicket fence. Hang on, I was talking about Chase's century. What about Bishoo's maiden first-class fifty tonight?

oh, no. What have you done, Bishoo? The first fifty will have to wait and that's stumps. He got a little too greedy, I reckon. Sees the flight and gets down on one knee to nail this slog. So far so good, except Sean Williams was lurking around the corner and was on the move as he held on to that rocket hit. Bishoo falls one short of his Test best too.

Strikes first ball! Took one last ball of day three, and takes on day four's first ball. A googly first up, full outside off and comes in sharply, squeezing through bat and ball. On a hat-trick, for the second time this Test.

full on leg, and the batsman misses the forward push. Misses and hits the pad. Appeals, and not out. Misses out on the hat-trick, but wait! He's going for the review. Nope, no hat-trick, pitched outside leg actually
full on middle stump, hoicked towards cow corner but Gabriel does the best thing possible for West Indies. Chooses not to run
back of a length outside off, goes straight through and while Chase shoulders his arms, the ball goes just an inch away past off stump
this time Chase ensures he's behind the ball's line. Back of a length on off stump and he rocks back and defends
good length outside off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, spins away from the rough and he pulls off the back foot to the deep-midwicket fielder. Oh, he's taken a single
full outside off, spins away from the right hander, prods forward and lets it go
Defended! Full on off stump, straight one this time, but Gabriel ensures he's got all the angles covered. Comes forward and defends off the front foot to end the over
full on leg stump, glances the ball past the wicket keeper's left and calls loud and clear for two. Moves on to 94
back of a length on middle stump, goes deep and punches off the back foot to long on. Calls for two, but Raza is quick to get the ball back. Will only be a single
full on middle and leg, defended. Technique on display
tossed up full on middle, steps forward and drives straight through. Came off the bottom part of the bat
there it is, the googly just outside off stump, but Gabriel picked it early. Defended off the front foot
full on leg stump, lobs up after hitting the pad's roll. No shot offered, over
full outside off, crunching drive on the off side, but straight to short cover
back of a length outside off, straight one, shoulders his arms
full on off stump and Chase settles down for a big sweep. Sharp turn away from the shot, and goes past his wild swipe to the keeper
back of a length just outside off, cut to point
good length on middle, goes deep and punches off the back foot with the bat's open face. But straight to point

And he's stranded on 95! Oh dear, the field changes played too much on Chase's mind. Tried to get the ton with a six, and goes for a wild slog off the over's last ball. Pushes it flat and quick on middle stump, goes straight through and removes the leg stump. West Indies finish with a lead of 433.
yorker first up, full on leg stump, squeezed away towards the leg side.
full on leg stump, drifts into his pads, and turned to deep midwicket for the first runs
full on middle and leg, driven straight, but the inside edge takes the ball towards short midwicket
full on middle, driven straight back. No swing this time and played on the up
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot
good length outside off, angles into the batsman who defends it off the back foot once again.
full just outside off, shuffles onto the off side and defends
good length on off stump, firmly defended off the back foot past the bowler
short just outside off stump, gets big onto Mire, but he cuts well. Goes to point though
full and wide outside off, left alone. No swing
full outside off, driven with minimal footwork towards the off side. Goes to cover
short on off stump and Mire can't resist it. Swivels, getting into position early, and pulled on the up over midwicket. No fielder in the deep in front of square, and that's four
it's full on off stump and Masakadza, solid as over, punches the ball off the front foot to mid off

looked good! It's good length just outside off stump, straightens after hitting the deck, and while the batsman defends off the front foot, the ball goes just past his outside edge and through to the keeper. Close
full on middle, tucked with soft hands towards the square-leg umpire and he calls early for the one
full on off stump, driven firmly down the ground
back of a length just outside off, defended with soft hands to see the over out
short on off stump, comes onto him quickly, defended from near his chest. Got into a tangle here, the batsman
short outside off and powerfully pulled! Got into position early and thwacks the ball for four
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot. Inside-edge onto his toes
full outside off, square drive on the up past point and cover. Two fielders give it a chase, and retrieved just inside the ropes
slower ball, very full outside off, almost no bounce this time. Rolls through to the keeper.
back of a length outside off, prods forward and defends, but takes the outside edge and goes along the ground past second slip's right for easy runs. No third man near the boundary
back of a length outside off stump, defended
full outside off, gets behind the line and drives through to mid on
slower ball, full toss just outside off, Mire's unsure how to play it, eventually bunts it to point
full just outside off, displays the full face of the bat while defending off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, angles into him, opens the bat's face, goes to the fielder at point
full and wide outside off, offcutter to be fair. Stays low, and dribbles through to the keeper as the batsman shoulders his arms
very full just outside off, gets his bat down quickly and squeezes it out
full outside off, quicker delivery, chooses to shoulders his arms. Carries through to Dowrich really well
good length just outside off, slight tail into the batsman as he brings out an extravagant on drive. Not timed as well, as the ball goes towards mid on.
full outside off, deviates towards the batsman after pitching, left alone once again though
back of a length outside off stump, stays slightly low as Masamadza chooses not to engage with that delivery
full just outside off, comes forward and defends
good length, outside off stump. Sliced through covers with a big stride
back of a length outside off, skids through low as he pokes away from the body with no feet
oh nicely done. Angles it in at the corridor from wide of the crease. This one is rising at him but he uses an angled bat to stab it between slip and gully...of which there are only one each
good length, angled in at off stump from wide of the crease. Defended into the off side on the front foot
aerial but wide of short midwicket and beats mid-on too. He was ready to flick this length ball on the angle but checked his shot at the last moment and got it in the gap
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left off the bottom of the bat
length and in at the pads. Shapes to flick early again and checks his shot. Wasn't to the pitch of this. Bunts it aerially back down the pitch and into the stumps at the other end
short and wide outside off, doesn't quite climb but there's enough width on it for him to adjust and get low as he dabs it through the gap in the cordon again
good length, in at leg stump. Offers the full face and pushes this to mid-on
good length, slanting in from outside off. Big stride to cover the off stump and lets this go
good length, slanted in at leg stump. Tapped to mid-on on the up
back of a length on middle, defended down the pitch from the crease
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length in the corridor, shapes in and straightens past the outside edge as he pokes at it
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
full outside off stump, no feet as he drives through the line. It's uppish but well past both Holder and mid-off
dreadful shot. Good length, wide outside off stump and climbing at him. A wild slash it and he's beaten
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
tossed up outside off, draws him forward and turns it sharply past the outside edge

well this is a bit comical. Length ball outside off, puff of dust and big turn as he looks to play the paddle sweep. He misses. So does the keeper. And so does first slip, who had rapidly run into the leg side in anticipation of the shot
short and wide outside off, cut straight to extra cover
good length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, defended into the covers
short and wide outside off, firm punch, straight to extra cover
length in the corridor, defended into the off side
full at middle stump, defended down the pitch
full at off stump from wide of the crease, driven on the up to extra cover
offcutter, good length outside off. Defended into the off side
good length, in at middle stump, pushed to midwicket with a closed face
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to cover point off the back foot
length and pushed through at off stump, big flowing sweep along the floor, to long leg
yikes. Length ball outside off, spins about four yards as he looks to sweep
big turn. Good length at off stump at the perfect pace. He's forced to play. Spins a long long way away past the edge
good length outside off, looks to sweep, under-edges it into the pitch and to slip
full at off stump, big stride forward to defend into the off side
pushed through outside off, lets it go
bouncer at off stump, looks to pull, splices it through midwicket with no timing. But there's no one to take that
offcutter, back of a length outside, poked into the off side from the crease
short and into the body, controlled pull shot to fine leg's left...and Gabriel there is very slow to it. Allows the second
short one at the ribs, pulled with some effort. This doesn't quite come on. Slots it between deep square and fine leg
full at off stump, driven down the mid-on
short and into the body. For some reason, square leg was suddenly brought into the circle. He pulls it past that man

what a shot. Oh, he's clattered this. What a sound. length ball at off stump, half a stride and then moves down with fast hands. No one could see where this sweep shot went till the ball hit the ropes
short and outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
oh poor ball. Short and just outside off. Sits up nicely and he pulls it wide of mid-on who was a few yards deep. Gave chase and put in the slide, but that was too quick to pull back
full at off stump, driven back down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length outside off, covers the off stump and lets it go
pull shot lands short of midwicket. Short ball into the body, late on the pull

overpitched ball outside off, he looks to chop it to third man with an angled bat. Jams the pitch into the ground and West Indies appeal as the ball goes through to the keeper. Not out says the umpire. They don't review
yorker on leg stump, squeezed out to midwicket
short and wide outside off, looks to slice this square. Beaten on the outside edge
good length and just outside off, defended into the off side
back of a length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
short on off stump, goes deeep into his crease and smashes that over midwicket for an emphatic four. Got into position very early there
tossed up full this time, just outside off, and spins away. Left alone
full on middle stump, big stride forward, and defended
full on off stump, gets that stride forward quickly and defends. Takes a bat-pad this time
full on off stump, prods forward to defend but the ball spins away from his bat's face. Just past the outside edge
full on off and this time he gets down on one knee to sweep this square! Settled in nicely and powerfully swept for another boundary to end the over
back of a length on the fourth-stump line outside off, straightens after hitting the deck, tries to defend off the wrong line and the ball goes past his outside edge through to Dowrich
full on off stump, solid defense off the front foot
full toss on middle stump, biffed down the ground to mid on
back of a length just outside off, defended firmly off the front foot
full on off stump, driven down the ground with soft hands and calls early for the single. They complete the run before mid on get to the ball
full on middle and leg, whipped off his pads towards cow corner, midwicket dives over the ball, and the sweeper in the deep has to run a long way to retrieve that
full on off stump, wrong'un this time, big stride forward and defended, loud appeal from Bishoo for lbw, but it was an inside edge to the pad
full on off stump, extravagant stride forward and driven. But straight to short extra cover
back of a length on off stump, goes to the back foot and punched to the fielder at short extra
good length on off stump, spins away slightly and the batsman shoulders his arms
full just outside off, legspin on offer, left alone
full on leg stump this time, tries to sweep with the spin but can't get bat to ball. Hits him on the body instead
back of a length just outside off, hurries through. Mire tries to poke at the ball but it's too near his body. He misses the late cut as the ball stays low, and goes to Dowrich at knee height
back of a length on middle, goes back and taps the ball towards mid on
good length just outside off, comes forward and defends with the bat's full face
back of a length on middle, worked off the hips behind square
short this time and well fielded by the midwicket fielder inside the circle. It was pulled along the ground, but straight to the fielder placed next to the square-leg umpire
short again to end the over, pitches outside off and goes past Mire's right shoulder to Dowrich
pitched full wide outside off, goes through to Dowrich. Mire disinterested to play at it
good length just outside off this time and Mire tries to cut. Goes back to make room, and then swipes at the ball, but straight to point
full on middle, swept behind square for a single. Two fielders in the deep on the legside for that shot
back of a length outside off stump, cut away from his body. Straight to cover
full on off stump, steps forward and defends the ball back to Bishoo
what a beauty! Full on off stump, steps forward to defend, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge. Stayed low, and almost took a feather off the outside edge
outside off, and it's a full toss, punched past cover, and Kemar Roach has to give it a chase. Flicks the ball back just inside the rope next to long off
good length on middle, offspin, goes down the leg side as Dowrich cannot hold onto it
back of a length on middle, worked behind square on the leg side. Calls early for the single
full on off, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, tries to work the ball towards the leg side, but straight to midwicket. Minimal foot work this time, though
full on off stump, taps the ball down the ground to long on. Walk through for the single
good length on middle, offspin, goes down the leg side, but not before rapping him on the pads
pitched up on off stump, gets into position early, down on one knee, and paddled to the deep on the leg side
full outside off, nice backlift and defended well
full just outside off and defended by Masakadza once again. Getting to the stride of the ball to negate the spin
full outside off, and driven to mid off
full on middle and off, tries to turn the ball behind square for one, but falls just in front of short leg and leg spin. And that's lunch. The two openers have brought the deficit down to 358.
full and wide outside off, leaves the first ball alone
full on middle, tries to drive straight, but takes the inside edge of the bat before hitting him on the front pad. Umpire Reiffel says no to the appeal

full just outside off, thinks about offering the shot, before deciding to shoulder his arms. But he makes the choice slightly too late, and the ball hits his blade as he tries to get out of the way. Bounces away to point
low full toss outside off, can't dispatch it for runs. The crunching drive goes straight to cover
timed! Full outside off and he brings his stride forward and drives - with the complete followthrough - past short cover's right for a delightful boundary
back of a length on off stump, tapped to short mid on

full just outside off, reverse swept from outside off stump for three runs. Not timed well enough, and Blackwood can race across to the right hander's third-man boundary from first slip to get the ball back
full on off stump, comes a few steps down the ground and punches the ball back to Brathwaite
full outside off, charges down and yorks himself. Bunted back to the bowler
flighted outside off stump, offspin on offer, and he rocks back to defend off the back foot

another reverse sweep! And this time it's from Masakadza. It was full on middle and leg, but Masakadza gets his front foot way towards the leg side, allowing his bat to sweep completely through. Good contact, and goes past first slip's right. Four this time
full on off, defended off the front foot
full on leg stump, goes down the leg side but Dowrich can't hold onto it either. Mire wants to run anyway, they take the single

full on leg stump, misses the drive down the ground, and hits him on the pad. Loud appeal! Turned down by umpire Reiffel. Holder wants to review. Up we go. Not out, confirms the third umpire. Was going down the leg side.
back of a length on middle and leg, worked to the leg side for a single. Midwicket misfields as he dives to his right. The sweeper-fielder has to cover up
good length on middle and off, pushed back past the bowler

full on off stump, well driven down the ground and Holder - at mid off - dives to his right to stop the ball. Can't completely stop it, but gets the pace off the shot. He recovers, races back towards long off, and throws the ball back
full outside off, punched down the ground once again. Holder fields at mid off
full on off stump, taps the ball down the ground to long off, and he walks through for a single. Fifty for the big man. The crowd's on its feet.
full outside off, Mire tries the reverse sweep, but misses the shot. Exposes all three stumps, as he tries to sweep. Would've gone on to break middle stump, if the ball didn't hit his glutes

back of a length on middle, Mire got into a tangle and the ball goes bat-pad and looped up. Shai Hope could've caught it, but he didn't realise the ball was near him. He turned his head away thinking the pull was well connected
full on off, defended
good length on off stump, charges down and taps the ball back to Brathwaite
Mire almost paid the price there. Pitched extra full this time, and the reverse sweep was nowhere near the ball. Goes past his bat, pad, glutes, and past the leg stump. He's lucky to survive.
overpitched outside off stump, muscles the ball past Gabriel to mid off
full outside off, tails back in, good leave
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
full outside off and driven square this time. Slashes hard at that, and the ball takes a thick outside edge. Goes between gully and point. No stopping that shot
full and wide outside off again, this time he opens the bat's face while driving towards the off side. Finds the gap between cover and point. More runs.
back of a length on middle, slower ball to end the over, works it around the corner to fine leg for a single
back of a length outside off stump, goes deep into his crease and punches the ball back to Brathwaite

And the part-timer strikes! Good length just outside off, tries to work the ball behind square on the leg side, but takes the bat's top edge, then the thigh pad, and lobs to short leg. No mistake from the infielder this time. Gobbled.
good length on off stump, goes straight through, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, defended off the front foot
full just outside off once again, prods forward and defended off the front foot once again
good length on middle, he steps back, going to the leg side, and makes good use of his wrists to clip the ball off his pads past midwicket. That's the team hundred. 334 more to win for Zimbabwe.

short and wide outside off, tries to get away from the shot, but the ball takes the outside edge - off the bat's shoulder - as Mire tries to avoid that delivery. Goes between the keeper and the fielder at second slip. Would've been gone if there was a first slip
full on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, tries to defend towards the off side, but the bat turns in his hand. Goes towards midwicket on the legside

offcutter, short outside off, comes sharply back to his body, just opens the bat's face, allowing the ball to go along the ground, between the keeper and the vacant first-slip region for four more. That wide second slip is doing nothing there
Good length on off stump, firmly defended off the front foot

And Mire misses out on a debut fifty! Full on leg stump, tries to squeeze the ball out, but takes the inside edge of the bat, then hits his pad, and then ricochets onto the stumps. The young man has to go after a promising show. A beautiful delivery, to be honest. Late tail in
good length outside off, goes straight through. Ervine sees it till late, and chooses to shoulder his arms
full just outside off, defended off the front foot
just misses the outside edge. Full just outside off, turns away from the left hander, as he misses the defense
full outside off, left alone
flatter, good length on middle and leg, goes down the leg side but Ervine shuffles towards the ball, and misses the whip
good length just outside off, left alone as the ball goes through to Dowrich
good length outside off, inswing, Taylor defends his first ball
yorker on middle, Taylor does very well to get his toes out of the way and get bat to ball
short outside off, the ball doesn't bounce as much though. Taylor ducked, moving his face away from the delivery, but didn't realise that the delivery goes just above his right shoulder
full on middle and leg, tries to clip the ball behind square on the leg, but he can't play that fine enough. Straight to backward square
overpitched outside off, driven back to Roach
full outside off, good contact on his drive, but straight to mid off.
good length on off stump, pushed to extra cover
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up full at off stump, waits for it to land in his arc and drives with control through extra cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to short extra cover's left
full and angled in at the stumps from wide of the crease, defended into the off side
good length, angled in at leg stump. Keeps low. An anxious stab at it with no feet. Big inside edge to fine leg
back of a length, swinging away late but from outside off. Doesn't go after it
good length, angled in at middle stump. Defended down the pitch on the front foot
full, late swing away again. But he doesn't have to play at that
good length, shaping away, too far outside. Left alone
back of a length at off stump, tucks it to midwicket with the turn, from the crease
good length at middle stump, walks a long way across and tickles this off his pad past leg slip. No lbw shout. That might have been close actually. Not too much turn and leg stump was visible
oh well bowled. Good length, pushed through quick and turns away just as fast. Past the outside edge as he stretches forward
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
beauty. Tossed up outside off and he doesn't allow it to spin. Gets to the pitch with a stride and whips it wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
140 kph, full and angled down leg side from wide of the crease. Floats past his attempted flick
nearly chips it to midwicket. This stops at him after angling in. He's looking to flick but the bat is well in front of the body when he makes connection
offcutter, full and wide outside off. Stretches a long way to try and drive. Can't time it
full and in at leg stump, flicks, very late to deep square
good length, skidding low at off stump. Defended into the off side from the crease
reverse swing coming into the batsman this time. Full and in at off. Watchfully pushed to mid-off
floated up outside off. Comfortably defended on the front foot
back of a length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length on middle stump, watches it closely before stabbing it past square leg
good length on off stump, defended off the outside half of the bat
short and in at middle stump. Firmly punched off the back foot, but he can't beat mid-on to his left
length on leg stump, tucked to deep backward square
good length, angled in at middle and leg. Watchfully tapped to short midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, angled into the corridor. Big forward stride to push to mid-on
short ball outside off, comfortably sways away
short one at middle stump. Watches it onto the bat and drops it into the leg side with soft hands
full and angled into the leg stump. Soft-handed nudge into the midwicket region
back of a length outside off, pushed wide of extra cover off the back foot. Ervine takes off for the run and Taylor responds late. They make it in the end
good length, pushed through flat on off stump. Defended into the leg side
floated up at middle stump, tapped to long-on with soft hands
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, too far out to be chased. Lets it go
good length on off stump, defended into the off side
short ball at off stump. Climbs on top of the bounce and drops it into the pitch
full and tailed into the leg stump. Pushes to midwicket
good length outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
length and in at leg stump. Can't get bat as he falls over in his attempt to turn it to fine leg. Thuds into the pads, appeal turned down. It was going down
good length at middle stump, uses his wrists to turn this to deep square
short and wide outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, pushed down the pitch off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at middle stump, dead bats against the turn on the front foot
full toss at off stump, tapped to long-off
full toss outside off stump, an easy put away. Slaps it to the extra cover boundary
good length, angled in from outside off. Shuffles to cover the stumps, lets it go

gloves it over the keeper after attempting to leave this bouncer. It pitches on off stump so he's ready to sway on line, but it follows him down leg side. In the end, he adjusts to ramp this to the keeper's left. Incredible shot in the end
short ball outside off, left alone
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the attempted flick shot
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
full and angled in at leg stump. Watches it closely. Defends to mid-on
tossed up outside off, steps down and meets it on the full to drive to long-on
full at off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off's right off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, drives firmly, albeit aerially, down to long-off

he's been given out lbw and he wasn't keen on the review. But Taylor changes his opinion. They've reviewed. He was caught right on the back foot in front of middle stump, as he tried to flick this. Looks plumb. He was ready to walk back, but was convinced otherwise...pitching on middle, hitting leg. Review lost.
short ball at middle stump. Gets outside the line at the last moment as it climbs for his throat
full and down leg side, misses on the flick shot
full at leg stump, defended to midwicket
full and angled into leg stump. Takes the flick on now that a fielder has moved out of the leg side. Pokes uppishly to deep square's left
overpitched on leg stump, controlled nudge to deep square
good length in the corridor, slight shape away. Defends away from the body
good length at off stump, tapped into the covers
good length at off stump, defended to extra cover
back of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
short ball outside off, spins and bounces a long way. He withdraws the attempted cut
short outside off, no turn this time. Quickly on the back foot to squeeze this drive through the covers. Brathwaite chases and pulls it back, but his leading leg is touching the rope
good length outside off, left alone
full outside off stump, pushed to mid-off's right
full and tailing in at leg stump. Inside half of the bat as he drives without feet. Onto the front pad and down the pitch
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
full outside off stump, driven on the up to extra cover
back of a length outside off, some nibble away. Defended away from the body
shapes it back in from a length, defended from the crease
back of a length and pushed through at middle stump, shuffles across and barely gets bat as he looks to flick
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
good length, pitches on middle, rips a long way outside off past the outside edge. Didn't climb that one
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, bat in front of pad, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length outside. A nervous push into the covers, away from the body. Very similar shot to his first innings dismissal
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the leg side with an angled bat
in the air but through the covers. Williams is not confident at all here. Length ball wide outside off. Chases it with no feet and slices aerially
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side on the up
good length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he stabs at it. Appeal turned down for caught behind. It was bat jamming into pitch, the sound.
length at off, pokes to mid-off and steals a single

oh it was coming from Williams. Poor show from an experienced batsman. Steps out at a length ball. Nowhere near the pitch. In the end he has to try ad block with bat and pad close together. He might have got an inside edge onto pad. It lobbed to the keeper who also took off the bails. Out two ways, possibly. Sums up his stay; he was offering chances everywhere
oh what a ball! Back of a length at leg stump, spins away sharply and nearly takes out off stump as he goes deep in the crease to try and defend
full at leg stump, driven forcefully to mid-on
full at off stump, defended on the front foot, close to the pad
good length outside off stump, gets well outside the line off off stump to defend
back of a length outside off, shuffles and defends into the leg side
good length at off, shuffles, sweeps. Finds long leg
back of a length outside off, punches through the open cover region
back of a length, pushed through at middle stump. Pushed down the pitch
full outside off, defended on the front foot, into the off side
short and turning away from off, pushed wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
full outside off stump, flowing drive, straight to extra cover
full at off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, left alone

full on middle and leg, misses the flick off his pads. Appeal in unison from everyone! Not out, umpire Reiffel says. Dowrich indicates it may have been drifting down leg. Yes, it was, plus an inside edge.
back of a length outside off stump, tries to punch it away from his body, with minimal foot movement, takes the inside edge of the blade and flies towards the leg side
full on leg, tapped off his toes to fine leg for two. Running at full pace to make the couple

back of a length on off stump, angles into Taylor since Roach uses the width of the crease. The ball stays low, and Taylor manages to flick the ball to fine leg for one. He was almost caught plumb in front of middle stump
full on middle, gets inside the line of the delivery and drives straight down the ground. Straight to mid on
good length just outside off, defended off the front foot. Played with the straight bat
tossed up first ball, full on leg stump, tapped towards short midwicket
full on middle and off, big stride forward and defended
back of a length outside off, spins further away from Taylor. Tries to cut it square, but plays under the ball. Sharp take from Dowrich
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
full on middle and leg, prods forward and defends with ease
flatter, back of a length outside off, goes deep into his crease and punches the ball back to Bishoo
full just outside off, gets inside the line of the ball by shuffling towards the off side, and defended
full on middle, straightens after pitching. Raza is watchful though...defends carefully with soft hands
back of a length on off stump, late tail into the batsman. Glanced off his hips to fine leg for a single
full just outside off, gets his front foot forward and defends the ball back past the bowler to mid on
back of a length wide outside off, but the ball comes into the right hander while in the air. Shoulders his arms, but the ball wasn't too far away from the outside of off stump
short and wide outside off, low bounce though. Shapes away from Taylor as the ball goes past him, no shot offered. Dowrich is on the floor trying to hold onto that
full on middle and leg, defended. Comes forward to negate the spin
full on middle this time, same shot offered. Defended
tossed up full on middle, defended before the ball can spin away
full on middle and off, prods forward and defends off the front foot
full just outside off, big step forward and defended with the straight bat
quicker one to end the over. Flat and full on leg stump, dug away towards short mid on
back of a length just outside off, angles into the right-hander, defended off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, defended
good length just outside off, comes inside the delivery's line and defends the ball back to Roach
full just on off stump, prods forward and defends tentatively with soft hands

full and wide outside off, and crunched past cover! In the slot to be punished, and that's exactly what he did. Caressed his drive shot, waiting for the ball to come to him, and then slit the gap between cover and extra cover
good length just outside off, slight inswing late, defended off the front foot
full on middle, drift into the batsman in the air, defended
short and wide outside off, spins further away, Raza does not want to play at it.
good length outside off, shoulders his arms
Slogged! tossed up full just outside off, settles down on one knee and that's been dispatched over long on for a six. Pounced onto that very quickly
full just outside off, driven to cover
full just outside off, drifts into Raza, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, late inswing into the batsman's body, Taylor gets his bat out of the way as the ball goes through to Dowrich
short on middle stump, the angle takes the ball down the leg side. Dowrich has to dive to his left to hold on to that delivery
good length just outside off, swings into Taylor's pads. Whipped to midwicket
short on middle once again, Taylor shuffles towards the off side and lets the ball go down leg
full and very wide outside off, left alone
short on off stump, gets behind the line of the ball, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off stump, chopped straight to cover point
back of a length at middle, forces it to mid-on off the back foot and steals a single
good length at off stump, plants a big stride forward and hammers the drive past mid-off
back of a length at off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
good length outside off, driven on the up to cover
short and wide outside off, cut straight to cover point
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot. Straightened after pitching
good length on middle stump, walks towards the off side, and tries to work the ball behind square leg, but can't make the contact. Gloves it
good length just outside off, punched to the fielder at cover
pitched short outside off, not directed at the player so quite easily lets it go. Ducks. Quick too, 143kph
short on middle, this time challenges Raza. Does well to move to the off side, and lets the ball go under his arm down the leg side

There's first and third slip, but the ball goes between them. Full outside off and he drives away from the body. Takes the outside edge, and would've gone straight to second slip if there was one. Instead, goes for four more. Quick stuff from Gabriel
full on middle, displays the bat's full face. Defended off the front foot
full just outside off, comes forward and defends off the front foot with an angled bat. The ball dribbles away towards short cover
full on middle, tapped down the ground past the non-striker
back of a length on middle stump, rocks back and punches the ball square off the back foot. Goes to point
full and wide outside off, slapped off the front foot to the off side. But straight to the fielder at cover (Hetmyer)
full outside off stump, Taylor simply lets it go
short on middle stump, sends the batsman ducking away
short outside off, directed towards his body, and sends Raza ducking for cover. Does well to get out of its way
back of a length outside off, angles into him, cut late from near his body. More runs. Huge no ball.

good length wide outside off, slapped to mid off and he calls very early for a single. They scamper through, and the fielder cannot get the direct hit. Good stuff from the batsmen, putting pressing on West Indies

And Taylor ramps it once again! Short just outside off and Taylor was quick to figure that out. Puts his bat up in the air, and allows it to hit his blade and go above the keeper's head. Two bounces and four. Another really big no ball.
fullish on off stump, tapped towards cover for a quick run

full on off stump, defended off the front foot. And clear frustration! Raza was inside the crease anyway, but Gabriel decided to throw it back to Raza. Raza almost hit it once again, but the ball goes past him, past Dowrich, and for four more. Bizarre!
full on middle and leg, worked towards the fielder at short mid-wicket
full just outside leg stump, turn brings the ball back to Taylor, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, a very fine paddle sweep employed by the batsman. Connects with the bat's under edge. Some runs
full outside leg, turns brings it into his body, but he offers no shot. Padded away
full just outside leg, tapped towards the empty region in front of square on the leg side. Dowrich has to race towards midwicket to stop more runs
good length outside off, rocks back and punches it off the back foot to cow corner. And that's Zimbabwe's 200. 234 more to go
full wide outside leg, pushed towards the leg side and calls for one
tossed full on off stump, offers the defensive shot, goes bat-pad past short leg's right. Close
full just outside off, defended with the bat's face towards cover
flat on middle stump, gets big onto Raza, but lets the ball go down the leg side
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot to Roach
good length just outside off, prods forward and defended
full just outside off, big stride forward. Defended to see the over off
tossed up on off stump, gets a big stride forward and converts it into a full toss. Swept past backward square for four. Also Taylor's fifty, his 8th fifty n Tests.
full just outside leg, paddled fine down the leg side. Misses the shot, but so did Dowrich
full on leg stump, swept to deep fine leg. Not much happening from the rough outside leg stump
good length wide outside leg stump, tries to work it behind square, but can't make the connection
full outside leg, gets his front foot near the pitch of the delivery and defends
full on leg stump and Raza sweeps as well! Shannon Gabriel - at deep backward square - can't get to the well timed shot
flat on middle stump, gets back and works the ball off his pads to short fine
back of a length on middle, pulls fine, but straight to short fine leg
good length on middle, tries to tuck the ball behind square. But tight bowling, can't get it away
good use of the wrists this time. Good length on middle, and he whips it off his hips past the square-leg umpire. It was momentarily in the air
good length just outside off, ball goes straight through. Defended. Takes the outside edge, and dribbles away to short third man
full on off stump, Raza comes down the wicket and whips it over short midwicket's head for a single
good length on middle stump, goes deep into his crease and pulls along the ground. Short leg has to hide for cover, and the ball goes to the sweeper fielder in the deep. Powerfully played
good length on leg stump, can't get bat to ball as the ball spins away from his blade's face
good length on leg stump, spins across his body. Tries to defend, but his bat is nowhere near the ball
good length on off stump, adjusts well to take consideration for the turn. Defended
Top edge, but safe! Full on leg stump and he sweeps. This time doesn't get the connection (bat closed too early) and it falls just past the fielder at short fine leg
full on middle, worked towards short midwicket
full on middle, defended back to Chase
full outside off, dances down the ground but can only drive it back to the bowler
flatter this time, pitches on off stump, Raza whips the ball off his pads towards backward square
good length just outside off, tapped to short midwicket. No room to free his arms
good length just outside off, goes deep into his crease, and defended
good length just outside off, lets it go
full outside leg stump, paddled fine to short fine leg's right for a quick run

And Bishoo takes a wicket off a loosener! Short on leg stump, spins across and he cuts this away from his body from outside off stump. He could've hit that for four anywhere, but...finds Chase at short extra cover. He's got to go, and Bishoo strikes. With that it's drinks.
ripper on off stump, goes straight through though. Defended off the back foot
flatter, but gives the ball a big rip once again. It's short and wide, and cut furiously past cover's right for four
full on middle, pushes the ball to mid off
flighted full on middle and leg, driven along the ground to mid off again
flat, good length just outside off stump, sharp turn inside his body, can't work the ball towards the leg side. Hits him near the thigh
full on off stump and that's premeditated. Gets his front foot across the line of the ball and then reverse-sweeps very fine past first slip
back of a length outside off stump, worked to the leg side
good length on middle stump, worked off his hips to backward square
back of a length on off stump, gets inside the line of the ball and taps the ball past short leg. But not enough power in the shot to take the run
good length outside off stump, defended with soft hands
back of a length, spinning across from outside off. Defended on the back foot
back of a length and climbing as it turns away from middle stump, he lets it go
good length outside off, left alone
full at leg stump, poked through midwicket
short and wide outside off, stands deep in the crease and slaps it to the cover boundary
good length at middle stump, defended off the outer half of the bat
full toss outside off, gets underneath it and chips over midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at leg stump, cops it high on the pad as he looks to flick
top edge floats over Gabriel at short fine. Not to the pitch as he looks to sweep. Gets a top edge because of the climb and he survives. 195 to win.
back of a length, pushed down leg side. Neatly gathered by Dowrich
good length at leg stump, pushed through square leg with a flick
full at leg stump, gets low to paddle sweep. Straight to short fine
good length at leg stump, pokes on the front foot, in front of the body. Leading edge into the off side
length outside leg stump, defended down the pitch
full toss outside leg, sweeps firmly but can't beat deep backward square
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
crashes into the pad as he looks to defend a length ball, well outside off
good length on off stump, defended into the leg side
good length, down leg side. Can't get bat as he looks to ramp it fine
back of a length at leg stump, dabbed to short fine's left
back of a length at middle stump, not in control as he pushes on the back foot to try and whip this. Closes the face early and it flies past midwicket off the edge
good length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside leg, spins towards the stumps where it meets the pads flush in front of leg as he shoulders arms

another partnership thrown away. Oh this will sting. Poor cricket. Back of a length at leg stump, he camps on the back foot and pushes this straight to the fielder at midwicket. Takes off for a run, hesitates, then goes through. Ditto at the other end. No one is calling. A direct hit where there was no run. Waller had barely crossed half of the pitch

oh it's worked! Well, well, well. They showed pictures of the old ball and you couldn't tell a seam used to be there. Bishoo has a seam now. And he gets it to rip away from leg stump. He looks to flick, closes the face too early and lobs back a simple return catch

full and swinging away from off stump. Chases and jams the bat into the pitch. Caught-behind appeal turned down...and Holder takes the review. Roach is shaking his head, he thinks it's not out and the review is unnecessary....he's right.
